proposal:
Here is a summary of the proposals and MIPs (Maker Improvement Proposals) that are currently being considered:

1. Modify Core Unit Budget (DECO-001): This proposal aims to modify the GovAlpha Core Unit Dai budget for the 2023-2024 fiscal year. It is of high priority and was proposed by Patrick_J and prose11.

2. MIP40c3-SP90: This proposal focuses on modifying the GovAlpha Core Unit MKR Budget for Q2 2023. It is also of high priority and was proposed by Patrick_J and prose11.

3. MIP90: This proposal, Liquid AAA Structured Credit & Money Market Fund, is of high priority and was proposed by BlockTower.

4. MIP91: Defender Contract Against Governance Attacks is a high-priority proposal put forward by AstronautThis.

5. MIP93: Utilizing Hats Protocol, proposed by Prose11, is of high priority.

6. MIP96: The Ecosystem Auditor Framework, proposed by Retro and Juan, is of high priority.

7. MIP97: The DAO-level Objective Framework, also proposed by Retro and Juan, is of high priority.

8. MIP98: The Work Proposal Framework, proposed by Retro and Juan, is of high priority.

9. MIP41c4-SP40: This proposal aims to onboard Nik0 as CES-001 Facilitator. It is of high priority and was proposed by juan.

10. MIP14c2-SP5: This proposal requests a protocol Dai transfer to fund TechOps Core Unit for March 2023, and it is of high priority, proposed by simonkp.

11. MIP14c2-SP4: This proposal extends the Starknet CU Budget (SNE-001) and is of medium priority, proposed by pyramidmaker.

12. MIP99: Offer DAI to CeFi Projects to Enable Real-world Use Cases is a high-priority proposal put forward by FluidFinance.

13. MIP100: Stable Asset Allocation Framework, proposed by rspa, is of high priority.

14. MIP40c3-SP88: This proposal modifies the TechOps Core Unit Dai Budget and is of high priority, proposed by simonkp.

15. MIP92c5-SP5: Vault Setting Amendment Subproposal, proposed by Doo_StableLab, is of high priority.

The proposals related to the Maker Constitution (MIP101) include:

- MIP101: The Maker Constitution
- MIP102: Endgame MIP Amendment and Removal Process
- MIP102c2-SP1: MIP Amendments Subproposals
- MIP103: The Stability and Liquidity Scope Framework
- MIP104: The Decentralized Collateral Scope Framework
- MIP105: The Real World Asset Collateral Scope Framework
- MIP106: The Ecosystem Scope Framework
- MIP107: The Protocol Engineering Scope Framework
- MIP108: The Growth Scope Framework
- MIP109: The Physical Resilience Scope Framework
- MIP110: The Interface Scope Framework
- MIP111: The Infrastructure Scope Framework
- MIP112: The Finance Scope Framework

The full list of proposals can be found in the forum RFC subcategory. Anyone with questions about MIPs should reach out to @blimpa or @Gala for assistance. There are also ongoing discussions about a BFF Partnership with GnosisDAO, increasing MIP efficiency through community polls, anti-inflationary proposals, auction-backed DAI, IAM for Surplus Buffer, and proposal ideas on the forum. The last day of modifications for proposals entering the March Cycle is Thursday, March 2nd at 00:00UTC.

The text suggests creating video tutorials for each feature and tool available in PancakeSwap. These videos should demonstrate how to use tools such as the lottery, leverage, and limit trading. This would help users understand and effectively utilize these tools directly on PancakeSwap via a pop-up integration.

Title: Proposal for Integration of SushiSwap on Solana's Serum Platform

   Background: Solana, a fast blockchain, supports over 50k transactions per second (tps) without sharding and costs approximately $0.00002 per transaction. Serum, an on-chain DeFi ecosystem built on Solana, recently launched its DEX. This proposal is submitted by EcoSerum, a Serum node, and not related to FTX. The proposer, Sam Bankman-Fried, has exposure to both SRM and SUSHI but has not been involved in the development of Sushi.

   Proposal: The Sushi community is invited to build out support for Sushiswap on Solana. Sushi rewards will be distributed proportionally to the Total Locked Value (TLV) in each Ethereum and Solana/Serum based Sushiswap, or fixed to each pool. The Sushi AMM will share liquidity and volume with the Serum orderbook by sending bids/offers into the associated Serum orderbook to simulate the curve. This allows the Sushi AMM to access Serum's orderbook liquidity. FTX and sollet.io are developing bridges from ERC20 to SPL (Solana token) Sushi, with Sushi also able to compose with a borrow/lending protocol on Serum for margin trading.

   Rewards: EcoSerum offers 50k SRM for contributions beyond the initial setup and 1 locked MegaSerum (1 million Serum) for contributions between 1-5. These rewards are locked for 1-7 years, with full lockup until Aug 1, 2021, and a linear unlock over the following 6 years. The rewards are intended for the Sushi community to use as they see fit. Additional rewards of 20k SRM for contributions beyond the initial setup and another 10k for contributions between 1-5 will be given to the building team.

   Timeline: The goal is to roll out pieces of this within a month, with completion before the end of 2020. Work is not expected to start in earnest until after the Sushiswap migration is complete.

Polygon is launching its zkEVM mainnet beta on March 27, 2023. This technology enhances Ethereum scalability by bundling transactions and proving them to the Ethereum layer-1 network, resulting in increased efficiency, speeds, and throughput with significantly lower fees. QuickSwap is asking its community to vote on whether they should launch on the zkEVM mainnet beta and future developments. The vote will take place from March 25 to March 27, 2023. Read more about this in the provided document before casting your vote and join the Reddit discussion forum for questions and discussions with the team and community.

The text discusses Rage Trade, a new perpetual swap protocol built on Uniswap v3. It explains that unlike Voltz Protocol, Rage Trade has not forked UNI v3's code but instead built on top of it, using Uniswap as the matching engine and adding libraries for leverage trading, leverage LPing, cross-margin, liquidations, and real-time funding rates. The authors argue that these changes require an additional use grant due to the use of Uniswap's BUSL protect code in their libraries. They believe that approving this proposal will benefit Uniswap by bringing new liquidity to UNI v3, investing in the design of efficient v3 LP strategies, and enabling a whole new world of Uniswap spot strategies using on-chain perpetuals. The authors invite the Uniswap community to discuss their proposal and ask questions.

The text discusses the unbundling of 0x Protocol and 0x Labs, with the former transitioning from being solely managed by 0x Labs to a community-owned entity. This involves separating their identities, internet presence, and content.

The post suggests three key steps: drafting a constitution for 0x Protocol, refreshing the 0x.org website to focus on the protocol rather than 0x Labs' products, and creating an independent blog for 0x Protocol content. The intention is to make these changes collaboratively, involving the community and potentially an outside design firm.

The text also mentions that similar steps have been taken by other projects in the ecosystem, such as ENS, Optimism, and PoolTogether, which have all introduced constitutions defining their mission, vision, and core values. The post plans to create an initial draft for 0x Protocol's constitution and seek community feedback.

Cairo 2.6.0 has been released with significant performance improvements that potentially reduce transaction fees in contract functions without requiring code changes. The mainnet upgrade is planned for about a week after testnet upgrades on March 5th and 6th. This version includes optimizations achieved through the use of Span<felt252> instead of Array<felt252> in external function signatures, aggressive inlining, and support for consts in more complicated types. Additionally, Cairo now supports if let and while let expressions similar to Rust. The performance improvements require recompiling contracts with the v2.6.0 compiler and upgrading them on-chain to enjoy the benefits.

The Swag Store is a platform where communities, such as Aragon, can establish their own eco-friendly merchandise stores. These stores sell exclusively recycled or second-hand products, locally produced to minimize long-distance shipping. Artists submit designs for these stores, and each design includes a production timeline. The Swag Store serves as a hub for recycling artists to exchange ideas and share sustainable production methods.

Anyone can create a Swag Store, controlled by one or multiple addresses or DAOs. It has its own governance token, the Swag Store Token (SST), distributed via a bonding curve. SST holders review applications and ensure sustainability rules are followed.

A project incubator called mylife+ was created, with its token serving as a proof of contribution token. New tokens get minted based on a price curve for contributions to mylife+ projects that benefit the planet and people. The Swag Store is a mylife+ project, and SST is bonded to another token, moos.

Contributors to the Swag Store development receive SST tokens based on their contribution, with an option to choose payment in either the project token or from the funding pool (capped at $200). Users can also buy SST tokens to fund the pool. The more users preferring cash over SST, the more SST can be bought.

The Swag Store will be built using Flutter and Aragon for governance. All contributions will be visible on GitHub, with Google Spreadsheet initially monitoring the proof of contribution token minting and distribution.

Artists worldwide can submit designs for community-voted products made from second-hand or repaired materials. Disputes are resolved through the Aragon court. As a customer, you can choose your preferred design, see local artists with crypto security deposits, and pay via smart contract (automatically converted into USDC). The artist then creates the product and receives payment once delivered. A portion of the funds also goes to the community store.

As an artist, you can select designs you're comfortable with, set prices for production and shipping, and make a security deposit for dispute resolution. Customers can see your pricing information and the calculated percentage for the DAO and designers.

The text discusses a proposal by @Llamaxyz to introduce a new type of productive collateral in Aave v3 Reserves, allowing users to deposit Balancer v2 and Curve Liquidity Provider tokens as collateral and earn rewards from Aura Finance and Convex Finance gauges. This new collateral type is expected to drive borrowing demand for listed assets and generate additional revenue for the Aave DAO. The proposal suggests creating ERC4626 strategies, with initial deployments utilizing Aura gauges, followed by a Convex integration. If approved, further governance approval will be required before deployment on the Aave protocol. Community feedback is sought on this proposal.

The text presents a proposal for an animated interview series on the NFTV Network, featuring ApeCoin holders weekly. Eligibility is based on having at least 10 $APE in one's wallet. The series would be produced by a decentralized team and streamed across various platforms, potentially including the Otherside. Episodes will be turned into NFTs and sold exclusively using $APE. The cost structure includes voice-over actors, licensing, design, web, and organization expenses, with a preference for 100% ApeCoin payment. The full proposal can be found on the ApeCoin forum. The implementation of this plan is subject to alterations for security, usability, and other factors that protect APE holders.

The team is not pursuing lending and borrowing due to competition issues in the DeFi space. A suggestion was made to integrate Venus API on their website for a common product usage. They could also utilize locked CAKE for direct borrowing within Venus liquidities. Binance Bridge, Gelato products, limit orders, and leveraged trading partners are already being used. The question is why not partner with Venus as well?
The Governance Fund Phase 1 proposal is now ready for voting in Cycle 2. It has been approved by a delegate for voting. For more information, refer to Voting Cycle 2 Roundup.

The text discusses a proposal for a community marketplace by the ApeCoin DAO. The marketplace aims to increase adoption of $APE, drive traffic to the ApeCoin DAO website, and reduce fees for community members. It will host all Yugaverse projects in a single UI, with reduced fees and native sales in $APE. Key features include leveraging an open-source on-chain orderbook, aggregating orders from major marketplaces, and offering no fees for users buying and selling in $APE. The marketplace will also have a .5% fee on $ETH listings and a .25% fee in $APE, with a portion of the fees sent to a community-held multi-sig wallet. Development will focus on creating contextual and ape-specific marketplace functionality. The AIP implementation is administered by the Ape Foundation, with potential alterations for security, usability, and protection of APE holders.

PandaPower DAO is proposing to build an Aragon app integrating with Balancer protocol for treasury management. The app will allow DAOs token holders to vote on changes to the vaultsâ€™ weighting distribution, and automatically adjust the pool's holdings based on agreed-upon weightings. The fees generated from the Balancer Pool will be distributed back to the DAO. The project is scheduled for delivery in four phases, with the final product release expected by October 31, 2020. The team consists of experienced blockchain developers and engineers, including Caos, Yifei Wu, Lei Wang, and Tao. The funding required is 100 ANT, to be transferred to the provided Ethereum address for server rental and R&D costs.

This ARFC proposes the implementation of a dynamic parameter change mechanism called GHO Steward for efficient risk management during the initial stages of Aave Protocol's native multi-collateral stablecoin, GHO. The GHO Steward multisig, consisting of DAO's risk providers Chaos Labs and Gauntlet, will enable swift adjustments to parameters like bucket capacity and borrow rate within predefined limits.

The mechanism aims to ensure transparency, flexibility, and decentralized governance while maintaining the peg and addressing market challenges during GHO launch. The proposed governance process involves a lean decision-making procedure with community involvement.

The GHO Steward will be deactivated after 90 days but can be renewed or removed by the DAO as needed. This approach underscores Aave Protocol's commitment to maintaining GHO stability and addressing market challenges during the launch period, while allowing for agile parameter changes in the short term.

Title: Proposal for a Gauge for inETHx/ETHx on Ethereum by InceptionLRT

   Summary: The proposal aims to establish a gauge for inETHx, the Restaked Token dedicated to ETHx, within Ethereum. InceptionLRT is an isolated Liquid Restaking protocol for Liquid Staking Tokens (LSTs). Its core feature is the issuance of Isolated Liquid Restaking Tokens (iLRTs) for each restaked LST, which can be traded and used in DeFi protocols without affecting the underlying LSTs. The goal is to increase liquidity for inETHx, supporting its integration into various DeFi protocols.

   Key Features:
   - Governance by ING holders who influence the protocol's direction and policies.
   - Incentive Allocation through gauge weight voting, directing incentives towards preferred liquidity.
   - Rate Provider for inETHx as an Oracle.
   - Regular security audits to ensure user fund safety.
   - A decentralized system with independent node operators powering growth and development, as outlined in the InceptionLRT Litepaper.

   Useful Links:
   - Website: https://www.inceptionlrt.com/
   - Documentation: https://docs.inceptionlrt.com/
   - Github Page: https://github.com/inceptionlrt/smart-contracts/tree/master
   - Communities: Twitter: https://twitter.com/InceptionLRT, Discord: https://discord.com/invite/gBswunawAn

Users can create a free NFT profile on PancakeSwap within 24 hours, provided they've staked Cake tokens for at least 24 months. This is due to the 24-month locking period announced by the PancakeSwap team.

Ridotto, a decentralized casino infrastructure protocol, introduces a custom slot machine on PancakeSwap bankrolled and played in $CAKE tokens. The open-source, bankrollable slot machine aims to maximize community profitability with an audited tech by CertiK. The base APY is competitive, non-inflationary, and does not dilute token supply. A burn mechanism will be implemented, a feature requested by the community. More details can be found on their website or Twitter.

The proposal aims to transition Badger rewards from Boosted to Pro-rata in the upcoming launch of the Badger Locked CVX Sett. This change would ensure equal APR for all depositors in both Badger and cvxCRV emissions allocated to the Sett. Excluding blCVX deposits from the Boost calculation allows depositors to still utilize their Boost power on other non-native Setts, while gaining the Badger & bcvxCRV bonus from being in blCVX. This adjustment is expected to make the Sett more appealing for users with smaller Stake Ratios and new depositors, all while maximizing CVX voting power for the DAO on Bitcoin pools rewards on Curve+Convex.

FIAT DAO is proposing the preliminary approval of veBAL gauges for two upcoming stable swap pools: FIAT-USDC-DAI and FIAT-FEI-FRAX. This follows the successful migration of their governance token liquidity to the Balancer platform. The FIAT protocol, a DeFi solution for providing liquidity to fixed income assets, aims to attract secondary liquidity by pooling it around a singular asset. The success of FIAT depends on this liquidity, as it offers competitive borrowing power and higher maximum LTVs due to its unique CDP architecture. The deployment of the stableswap pools is under discussion, with potential concerns regarding varying levels of A coefficients for stability. The FDT token holders determine which assets are supported as collateral and the parameters associated with each. The vote on this matter is now live.

In April 2021, the Maker community discussed and voted on an upgrade to the Maker Protocol's Liquidation System - Liquidations 2.0. A related article from the Maker Blog will aid in understanding next week's Maker Relay event.

The text discusses the development of a Maker Risk Dashboard aimed at simplifying access to risk-related information for community members. The dashboard focuses on automated risk metrics, particularly loan facilities at Maker, and includes metrics such as liquidations risks, collateralization ratio distribution, and collateral asset metrics like DEX & CEX volumes, price drawdowns, and volatility patterns.

The team plans to open-source the model for interactive use, improve quantitative modeling, and conduct stress tests. Future developments include organizing risk proposals, evaluating collateral assets, and analyzing liquidation efficiency metrics, vault users' behavior, DAI stats, and stress testing capabilities. The team encourages feedback on their current dashboards and roadmap. They aim to primarily focus on risk analytics rather than broader business intelligence for Maker.

Proposal topics related to platform governance should be categorized accordingly, while general discussions about governance structure (e.g., voting systems, grant setup) may belong in a separate category.

1. The amount of gas reimbursed depends directly on the number of eligible swaps, with 130,000 gas for one swap, 220,000 gas for two swaps, 300,000 gas for three swaps, and 400,000 gas for four or more swaps.

2. The estimated gas price for display purposes is the median from the last few blocks according to the `getGasPrice()` function from the web3 provider, providing a good approximation of the median of the actual trade block.

3. The estimated BAL/ETH price for display purposes is queried from the 80/20 BAL/WETH pool on Balancer Exchange, acting as a real-time oracle and not used to compute an actual award amount.

4. The user will see the final result of #1-3: the approximate amount of BAL to be awarded for this particular trade, assuming there are still funds left in the budget, along with a USD estimate for completeness.

5. At dispersal time (computed by open source mining scripts):
   - Determine the number of eligible swaps, where an eligible swap is one leg of the overall trade in which both tokens are on the whitelist.
   - The actual gas price is the median from the block containing the trade, with artificially low-price transactions filtered out.
   - The actual BAL/ETH price is queried from the CoinGecko API for the time closest to the block time of the trade.

6. The UI changes are still being finalized, but a mockup can be found in the provided image.

7. Potential sources of error between the estimate and the actual award include variations in the median gas price from the last few blocks and differences between the 80/20 BAL/WETH price and CoinGecko's BAL/ETH price, but these should be relatively small.

8. Consult the proposals from former iterations of the campaign for additional details not covered in this summary:
   - Original proposal: https://forum.balancer.finance/t/proposal-balancer-exchange-gas-reimbursement/705
   - Expanding the eligible token list: https://forum.balancer.finance/t/proposal-expand-the-exchange-gas-reimbursement-to-all-whitelisted-tokens/799
   - Extending the program duration from 4 weeks to 8 weeks: https://forum.balancer.finance/t/proposal-extend-the-exchange-gas-reimbursement-program-4-weeks/1121

The Mode core team proposes the deployment of wstETH (Wrapped staked ETH) to Mode, with the aim of the Lido DAO accepting ownership of the wstETH bridging components. Mode is rapidly growing as a DeFi hub on the Superchain, already reaching TVL of 700m overall and 550m in dApp TVL within just 12 weeks since mainnet release. The deployment of wstETH would unlock new opportunities for users and dapps on Mode. The Mode and Ethereum addresses associated with the wstETH bridge have been specified, along with the roles and emergency breaks for each blockchain. The Lido DAO is being encouraged to consider this proposal.

Afrocritik, a leading African media outlet showcasing art and entertainment globally, aims to leverage the Astar Network for digital creativity growth in Africa. With a large online presence, they plan to initiate an extensive web3 education campaign, focusing on educating African creators about the benefits of Astar Network. This will involve weekly newsletters, biweekly podcasts, and social media campaigns. The goal is to raise awareness, bridge the gap between Astar Network and African artists, identify potential collaborators, and promote the use of web3 technology in Africa. The proposed budget for this initiative is $1450.
52.94 remDIGG will be minted and distributed to restore boost for DIGG holders impacted by the exploit. For more details, visit the forum at badger.finance.

33rd Collateral Onboarding Call: Discussion on projects and potential assets for MCD. The presentation will be by Joseph McNeila from Monachil Capital Partners (Monachil). They aim to partner with entities using unique technology to serve underserved markets and streamline loan origination. This is in relation to the MC-DROP Token and their MIP6 Application: Monachil Capital Partners LP, which proposes a Senior Secured Credit Facility for a private credit fund. The call is scheduled on June 25 at 3PM UTC, dial-in details are available on Zoom with passcode RWA-WG.
24-month Cake token stakers within 24 hours of Pancakeswap announcing a 24-month locking period.
7% manager fee will be applied to all LP rewards from Bril Finance's vaults.

This proposal aims to increase the capFactor of DEXG (the governance token for the DEXToken Protocol) from cap1 to cap2, as its liquidity on Balancer has surpassed $3M. The DEXToken Protocol offers a unique DeFi infrastructure with an advanced Automated Market Maker and leverages the off-chain capabilities of the Flowchain IoT network. The smart contracts are currently in open beta testing, with the Mainnet launch scheduled for Q1 2021.

Title: Proposal for Deployment of Aave V3 on BNB Chain

Summary: The proposal aims to deploy Aave V3 on the BNB Chain, expanding Aave's presence and leveraging the growing DeFi ecosystem and user base of BNB Chain. Assets like BNB, WBTC, BETH, WETH, USDC, and USDT will be available for collateral.

Abstract: Upon community approval, Aave V3 will be deployed on the BNB Chain with suitable assets for collateral. This move aims to foster growth and collaboration between both communities, offering new opportunities for both ecosystems.

Motivation: Deployment benefits include access to BNB Chain's user base and DeFi ecosystem for Aave, as well as diversifying DeFi options for BNB Chain users by hosting a flagship project like Aave on its platform.

Specification: Suggested risk parameters are provided for each asset in the table below. The table includes Isolation Mode, Enable Borrow, Liquidation Threshold, and other relevant parameters.

Deployment Checklist:
- Risk service providers feedback
- Infrastructure/technical evaluation report
- Oracle recommendation (Chainlink)
- The graph support
- Cross-chain messaging infrastructure for governance

Next Steps:
1. Integrate the infrastructure/technical evaluation report once available.
2. Refine the proposal based on community feedback and risk service provider recommendations.
3. If consensus is reached, submit the proposal for a snapshot vote for final approval.
4. If approved, submit a deployment AIP to activate Aave V3 BNB.

Disclaimer: The Aave-Chan Initiative (ACI) is not compensated by Binance & BNB for this proposal. It has been prepared solely to facilitate community discussion. At the time of writing, the author owns a small amount of assets on the BNB chain.
A year ago, multiple attempts were made to repay AAVE, but these efforts were unsuccessful. Now, the account is close to liquidation, which is perceived as unfair behavior.

Proposal to establish a marketing channel for discussing content needs, including content writers, social media managers, graphic designers, and video creators. Resources, number of resources, and budget management will be discussed initially. Additional requirements can be decided later by the team.

The text proposes a concept for a Pancake Squad NFT Leveling Up system integrated with the pool and Pancake point system. Each squad has a level, and higher levels yield a higher boost in the Cake locked pool. Points are collected from various Pancake activities to level up the squad, which can then be used to increase the yield boost rate on the locked cake pool. This encourages user ownership of Squads, increases engagement with Pancake, seamlessly integrates NFT into the system, and provides NFTs with value that generates income from the Cake Pool.

The text discusses a dashboard developed by Lido for monitoring Ethereum validators. The dashboard provides various metrics about the performance of validators, including rewards, penalties, and missed rewards for different duties such as attestation, sync committee, and propose. It also shows the total earned (total rewards minus total penalties), a summary table of each selected node operator, and per-duty separated tables for rewards, penalties, and missed rewards over a selected time period. The dashboard aims to help contributors and Node Operators understand the performance of Lido validators compared to the rest of the Consensus Layer. Lido is seeking feedback from the community on what else could be implemented to improve the dashboard.

Community Call on April 27, 16:00 UTC featuring Yaron Velner from B.Protocol discussing What is B.Protocol, its current state, governance transition to the community, experimental integration plans, compatibility with the new liquidation system upgrade, and a Q&A session. Resources available at B.Protocol.org and BProtocol Discord. Recording will be posted.

Title: Ape Finance Proposal for DeFi in ApeCoin Ecosystem

   The proposal aims to allocate 250,000 ApeCoins towards Ape Finance (ApeFi) to build DeFi solutions centered around ApeCoin. This funding will be used for security audits, protocol-owned liquidity, and general overhead. If approved, voters will receive APEFI tokens based on their voting power, and addresses that voted with over 825 ApeCoins will be eligible for an NFT allowlist.

   The motivation behind this proposal is to provide ApeCoin holders the ability to borrow ApeUSD instead of selling ApeCoin, preserving its value. This DeFi integration offers more utility to ApeCoin holders and helps avoid potential mistakes like the Bitcoin Pizza story.

   ApeFinance is developing DeFi tools for the metaverse, with ApeUSD as the stablecoin. Users can collateralize ApeCoin to mint ApeUSD, and APEFI serves as the governance token. ApeCoins can be deposited and borrowed at ape.fi.

   The proposal seeks 250,000 ApeCoins from the Ecosystem Fund for ApeFi's development, with distribution of APEFI tokens to voters within 7 days after the vote ends. Implementation can begin immediately upon confirmation of a passing FOR vote. The total cost is 250,000 ApeCoins from the Ecosystem Fund.

The text discusses a governance election for the decentralized finance project, SushiSwap (SUSHI). The election aims to transfer ownership of SUSHI to a multi-signature wallet, managed by nine elected candidates. These candidates will be responsible for decision-making, including organizing future votes, deploying contract changes, managing treasury and grants, and potentially transitioning to a DAO mechanism in the future. The election is open to all SUSHI-ETH liquidity pool stakeholders. The process was initiated as promised during the handover of SUSHI to Alameda Research's CEO, Sam Bankman-Fried (@SBF_Alameda).

Lido conducted a survey among its 21 Node Operators (NOs) regarding MEV extraction and rewards distribution post-Merge. Most NOs are considering MEV extraction, with 76% expressing willingness to do so either through Lido or independently. They are also actively involved in MEV-related discussions, as 40% of NOs are part of the Flashbots Eth 2 Working Group. The majority (85%) are interested in participating in potential MEV-minimization experiments within Lido. Respondents are open to following a DAO-ratified policy on MEV extraction and rewards distribution, but some need additional information for commitment.

Ether.fi proposes adding weETH as collateral in ETH markets on Optimism and Base. The demand is expected due to the popularity of eETH, an LRT that allows users to stake their ETH and earn rewards. Over 2 billion dollars worth of ETH has been deposited into ether.fi protocol. The team behind ether.fi prioritizes decentralization, sustainability, and acting in the best interest of the Ethereum community. WeETH on Compound can potentially drive growth, especially in the LRT sector. However, there's a 100% redeemable feature for ETH with instant withdrawals ensured by liquidity reserves. Users who deposit weETH into Compound will earn points for future incentives. The community is invited to consider this proposal and suggest improvements.
Collaborates with SafePal, Binance Launchpad, Launchpool, and projects within the Binance Labs ecosystem for Integration into Initial Farm Offerings (IFO) on PancakeSwap.

Wyoming has recognized Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs) as a new type of Limited Liability Company (LLC), effective from July 1. This move could potentially benefit DAOs like Aragon Association, as they can now operate with the legal structure and protections offered by an LLC in Wyoming. The state is open to feedback from the user community to improve its existing DAO legislation and consider further enhancements. Notable figures in the blockchain space, such as Aaron Wright, are actively involved in creating and managing DAOs like The LAO and Flamingo DAO.

This text discusses a proposal for creating a Token Curated Registry (TCR) for the Aragon Experts Program. The TCR aims to create a trustworthy list of experts within the Aragon Ecosystem, managed by those who use and rely on the program. The rationale behind this proposal is to address the growing demand for experienced professionals in the Aragon Ecosystem and ensure a decentralized mechanism for managing participants. The proposed team member, Cristopher, has contributed to the 1Hive community and is currently creating scripts using @aragon/toolkit scripts. The requested funding of 250 ANT (approximately $1930 USD) will be used for building this TCR and its UI.

The text provides guidelines for creating proposals within the Conviction Funding Pilot category on the Aragon Forum. To submit a proposal, users should create a topic using the provided template, which includes sections for title, proposal information, description, rationale, expected duration or delivery date, team information (for funding proposals), and funding information (also for funding proposals). The proposal should be detailed and relevant to ANT holders, the Aragon community, and/or DAO ecosystem. Proposals can be linked to on-chain at conviction.aragon.org. General discussions about the program should be held in the Community or Product categories.

Title: Proposal for Gauge for inmETH/mETH on Ethereum

Summary: The proposal aims to enable a gauge for the pairing of inmETH and mETH on Ethereum, proposed by InceptionLRT. InceptionLRT is an isolated Liquid Restaking protocol designed to enhance DeFi landscape fluidity and accessibility. Its core feature issues Isolated Liquid Restaking Tokens (iLRTs) for each restaked Liquid Staking Token (LST). These iLRTs can be traded freely and used in other DeFi protocols while maintaining segregation from the underlying LSTs. The goal is to increase liquidity of inmETH, supporting its utility and integration into various DeFi protocols.

Governance: ING holders participate in decision-making, influencing the protocol's direction and policies.
Incentive Allocation: Through gauge weight voting, veING holders direct incentives and rewards towards preferred liquidity, impacting the protocol's dynamics.
Oracles: InceptionLRT serves as a Rate Provider for inmETH.
Audits: InceptionLRT undergoes security audits to ensure user fund safety.
Centralization vectors: InceptionLRT strives towards decentralization with independent node operators powering its growth and development, as detailed in the EigenLayer - Inception iLRTs Docs.
Market History: No major volatility observed for inmETH on CoinGecko.

The Optimism Foundation's Governance Fund has initiated its first voting cycle, starting on June 9 and ending on June 22. This cycle includes proposals from Phase 0 of the fund, which aims to reward early projects in the OP ecosystem, fairly allocate OP tokens, and avoid setting a precedent for future funding proposals. Proposals that adhere to the set guidelines have been bundled into a batch vote, while those that did not will be voted on individually due to non-compliance with the deadline or guidelines. The batch proposals include submissions from Synthetix, Perpetual Protocol, Lyra Finance, Celer Network, Hop Protocol, Stargate Finance, Synapse Protocol, Chainlink, Rubicon, Zipswap, Thales, Aelin Protocol, Polynomial Protocol, Kwenta Protocol, Pika Protocol, Connext, Layer2DAO, Clipper, 1inch Network, Slingshot, Gelato, Aave, Wepiggy, and more. Individual proposals include Uniswap and 0x.

The proposal seeks financial support from the APECoin DAO for a project called Ape Drops, aiming to create a curated NFT platform for the Ape community. The goal is to release multiple weekly NFT drops featuring top designers and musicians in the space. Funds will be used to expand the team and finance NFT drops and events with high-profile artists. The project will only receive funds upon reaching key milestones, and any significant deviations from the plan will be disclosed to the APE holder community.

The text describes a governance election for the multi-sig ownership of $SUSHI, a cryptocurrency. The elected multi-sig owners will manage various responsibilities such as organizing future votes, deploying contract changes, managing treasury, and potentially overseeing a transition to a DAO mechanism. The election is open to $SUSHI-ETH LP stakeholders, with the Top 9 candidates being elected to each hold one key, requiring 6 keys for any changes to be made to $SUSHI. This decision follows a Twitter vote and a previous promise during the handover of $SUSHI to @SBF_Alameda.

Gauge weights for CRV distribution are being updated at midnight UTC. Users can now see projected CRV Annual Percentage Yield (APY) based on current votes. Voting ends at midnight at this address: Curve DAO.

InfStones, a global blockchain infrastructure provider, aims to offer node management services for Astar's network and its community. As a crucial part of Astar's network, Collators are responsible for tasks like block production and transaction confirmation. InfStones, with experience in PoS chains since 2018, seeks to leverage this expertise to deliver a reliable service.

The node management system will be utilized using dApp rewards, with improvements based on performance data. InfStones plans to support the service for future Shiden upgrades and will actively monitor and maintain it. Additionally, a portion of the staking rewards will be used for marketing and educating the Astar community about the Shiden network's node management service.

InfStones has extensive experience in staking services, having been an early supernode on EOS and TRON, and providing staking and node services to its community. It also offers data API services on over 50 blockchains, recognized by industry leaders like Dune Analytics, Nansen, and The Graph.

Phoenix Labs is proposing an airdrop formula for pre-farming, where the Airdrop is calculated as 80% of DAI borrows in USD plus 20% of ETH supplies in USD. All values are converted to USD using on-chain oracle prices. The airdrop starts from block 17956537 (August 20, 2023, 14:25 UTC) and ends either when the SubDAO token farming starts or by May 20, 2024, 14:25 UTC. A total of 30m SPK tokens will be allocated to the airdrop if the full 9 months elapse, otherwise it will be pro-rated. The formula is computed for every account on each block within the valid time range, and the final airdrop is calculated by summing the Airdrop value over included blocks. This applies only to Ethereum Mainnet; no other chain is included in the airdrop. Attempting to manipulate the airdrop by lending sDAI while borrowing DAI or vice versa will forfeit your inclusion in the airdrop.

The Formal Submission Window for February's Governance Cycle is open until Thursday. Eligible proposals include MIP90, MIP91, MIP93, MIP13c3-SP14, MIP95, MIP96, MIP97, MIP98, MIP4c2-SP30, MIP4c2-SP33, MIP74c1-SP1, MIP41c4-SP40, and more. These proposals are related to various aspects such as liquid credit structures, governance attacks defense, ecosystem auditing, and budget modifications. The final list of formal submissions will be presented on Thursday during the Governance and Risk Call. New proposals like MIP101: The Maker Constitution have been introduced, which will be eligible for March's Governance Cycle. Community members are encouraged to explore these new MIPs and provide feedback.

The Balancer community proposes modifications to the token whitelist for BAL governance token distribution. New tokens will be added at a cap of $1M. Community members can suggest tokens via the #token-requests channel in the Balancer Discord. Proposed additions include ARCX, MPL, O-OCEAN-MAR22, SALT. The changes take effect on April 26. Tokens are not added to the exchange UI; they can be traded using contract addresses. Price pegs for some tokens will be added to BAL mining scripts. Some requested tokens were omitted due to lacking price feeds via CoinGecko API, which is essential for calculating pool eligibility for BAL rewards.

The text discusses a proposal for forming a communication team called ApeComms within the ApeCoin ecosystem. This team aims to enhance the dissemination of news, information, and educational content. The need for clear communication between the Special Council, Ape Foundation, and the ApeCoin Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) has been emphasized due to recent discussions on council elections, staking delays, bug bounties, etc. The role of ApeComms is to facilitate information flow among the community, Ape Foundation, and related entities. They aim to increase awareness, participation, and education of token holders by creating new communication channels. The proposal is administered by the Ape Foundation, with the possibility of modifications for security, usability, or to protect APE holders. Any significant deviations from the initial proposal will be disclosed to the community.

The proposal aims to whitelist VitaDAO's Gnosis Safe multisig for vote-locking B-80BAL-20WETH into veBAL, enabling participation in Balancer DAO governance and voting for increased rewards in Vita<>ETH pools. VitaDAO, a community DAO funding longevity research, is a supporter of Balancer and has its main liquidity pools listed with them. The proposal carries the risk of allowing smart contracts to vote-lock veBAL, but VitaDAO commits not to tokenize veBAL using this safe. The Gnosis Safe multisig address for whitelisting is 0xF5307a74d1550739ef81c6488DC5C7a6a53e5Ac2.

Title: Regulation Proposal for GraviAURA in Balancer Gauges

   Proposed by: $1500Badger, with feedback from community, Badger core team, and Balancer team.

   Objective: To impose regulations on graviAURA LPs to better support BadgerDAO, BalancerDAO graviAURA holders, and LPrs by preventing overvoting in gauges with 10% or more of the total vote weight. The excess vote weight will be used to vote for core pools based on bribe distribution.

   Key Points:
    - GraviAURA's excess vote weight will be used to vote for Balancer core pools, driving emissions to pools earning the highest fees.
    - This alignment with market forces is ideal compared to voting for specific pools in an ever-changing landscape.
    - The regulations will expire after 3 months to allow for more complete governance as more data becomes available.

   Vote:
     - Yes: Enact this regulation to graviAURA in Balancer gauges
     - No: Leave the current implementation of graviAURA in Balancer gauges as is

The proposal aims to develop an analytics platform for Balancer LPs, improving efficiency, transparency, and user experience in the rewards mining process. Key features include optimized rewards calculation scripts, real-time data synchronization, decentralized backups, a rewards explorer UI, accurate predictions of APY, a rewards simulator, API integration, and tools for other protocols to integrate the rewards mechanism. The project will be open source under MIT license and is estimated to take 3-5 months and cost around $40k. The lead developer, Jakub Wojciechowski, has extensive experience in the blockchain space, having worked on various projects including a transparent donations platform, fixed-rate lending protocol, impact investing protocol, and more.

The Venus community has begun implementing a three-prong strategy following the approval of the RWA proposal. The first prong aims to establish a sound foundation for VAI by addressing its current unpegged state and low capitalization, with plans to assist other Venus teams in this process. The second prong focuses on expanding the supply of VAI while generating returns, exploring the possibility of using low-risk, liquid backing such as t-bills or corporate bonds. The third prong involves creating a legal structure (VE68) for potential higher-yielding solutions like Credix, which is expected to generate significant revenues for Venus. The team plans to initiate these steps immediately, acknowledging the challenges ahead but expressing optimism for the project's future.

1. The project is currently undergoing audits by various government ministries and code audits with prominent blockchain code auditors.

2. Communities related to the project can be found on ShuttleOne's Telegram and Twitter.

3. The CAT token represents debt based on cargo in transit for trade financing, with a 1:1 hard peg to Dai. It is backed by cargo assets against Bill of Lading.

4. Legal responsibility for the collateral resides in the countries where the borrowers reside. In case of default, ShuttleOne has agreements and operational partnerships with port operators to confiscate collateral.

5. The asset exchange occurs within the dex (decentralized exchange) of ShuttleOne between funders and borrowers.

9. Parties interested in taking part in liquidations for the proposed Collateral type include hospitals, government health ministries, supermarkets, and energy & chemical traders. The type of liquidators varies depending on the type of cargo being financed, with a focus on medical supplies, wholesale food supplies, and commodities (oil & chemicals).

Title: AIP-440: Boosting Exposure for Brands Accepting ApeCoin as Payment

Author: @CryptoDilly

Objective: To enhance the utility of ApeCoin by promoting its adoption as a payment option among brands, particularly Made By Apes (MBA) brands. This will be achieved through content creation, featuring brands that accept ApeCoin in their transactions.

Key Approach Areas: Editing & Production, Time Compensation, Product Acquisition

Activities:
- Creating a content calendar highlighting ApeCoin accepting brands, prioritizing MBA brands
- Developing transparent guidelines, managing expectations, and fostering partnerships
- Producing high-quality content for increased exposure
- Collaborating with brands to showcase their physical products as digital-native brands
- Supporting builders within the ApeCoin ecosystem by purchasing and showcasing their products
- Conducting giveaways of selected brands to increase exposure

Desired Outcomes:
- Creating content for resource-lacking brands
- Producing high-quality content for increased exposure
- Developing a transparent content calendar with deliverable deadlines
- Showcasing builders utilizing ApeCoin as a purchase option in a series of videos
- Representing sponsorship by ApeCoin in all produced videos
- Supporting builders within the ApeCoin ecosystem through product purchases and showcases

Total Funding Requested: $97,400 USD from the ApeCoin Ecosystem Fund.

The text proposes a decentralized finance (DeFi) instrument, specifically a risk pool for Ethereum (ETH), managed by MakerDAO using smart contracts. Users deposit DAI into the pool and can withdraw their proportional share at any time, with a rate set by the pool's contract that is less than 1. If the price of ETH drops below a specified strike price X, users can withdraw 100% of their proportional share. After an early withdrawal, the remaining capital is forfeited to the pool, increasing payouts for other users and providing MakerDAO with equity within the pool. The instrument is designed to be semi-perpetual, holding no expiration, and would wind down if the strike price is met or if participation drops below a certain number. The proposal suggests that this could generate significant revenues for MakerDAO due to fees and network effects, while also potentially hedging Maker's exposure to ETH. The text requests feedback on both technical and financial aspects of the proposed instrument.

Weekly ad auction system is proposed for PCS, where one partner can advertise their project each week. Bidding is done using a digital currency called CAKE. The collected CAKE from these auctions will be burned, and only one advertising space is made available.

Swerve Finance is a community-owned fork of Curve, offering fairer tokenomics for Liquidity Providers. It has a maximum supply of 33M SWRV tokens. The text describes a governance election for a multi-sig wallet ownership of $SUSHI, a cryptocurrency. The elected multi-sig owners will manage the treasury, grants, and contract changes, as well as organize future votes for the long-term interest of $SUSHI and its community. A smooth transition to a DAO mechanism is possible with a future community vote. The text discusses a proposal for MKR holders and delegates to vote on the Target Spend Level, which is the maximum amount (excluding gas) that the protocol should spend over the next 6 months. This decision aims to reflect the result of a vote to return to cash flow breakeven. The voting options range from less than $10M to more than $17.5M, with various implications for profitability and Core Unit budget cuts. The poll will run for one week due to market conditions. The proposal is part of a budgeting process and provides an important signal to Core Units as they develop their budget proposals. An open source model has been developed for community members to create their own revenue projections and associated Target Spend Level.

The proposal aims to address the issue of inflationary dumps in PancakeSwap's native token, CAKE, by retiring the locked pool and introducing a flexible all-in-one pool. This new pool will combine various syrup pool rewards, a portion of CAKE emissions, and platform revenue share. The goal is to provide users with attractive APR returns, reduce CAKE emissions, and promote long-term holding.

The new pool will work by pooling resources, offering diverse APR returns, reducing CAKE emissions with substitution by other project tokens and stable coin earnings, and promoting growth of other projects on the platform. It will also auto-compound CAKE earnings but not syrup rewards or stable coins.

This change is expected to positively impact the price of CAKE by moving towards a deflationary model, increasing scarcity and attractiveness, and driving more investor participation due to its flexibility. Additional steps suggested include developing further utilities and burn mechanisms, and increasing the allocated buyback and burn fund during price dips for increased effectiveness.

Token holders can receive an airdrop, with the snapshot occurring on April 15, 2023. The minimum token amount is equivalent to $200 at the time of the snapshot. Tokens are allocated proportionally based on blockchain address balances. Supported networks include ETH, BNB, POLYGON, and OPTIMISM.

The proposal aims to integrate ApeChain into the IYK platform, starting with Q3 activities such as revising the prototype of The Happy Ape plush toy, manufacturing 5,000 units, publishing a children's book, and ordering 5,000 copies. In Q4, the focus will be on finalizing the NFC integration into the books, testing the app, e-commerce site, and DApp, launching the e-commerce site (thehappyape.io), delivering products to schools and hospitals chosen by the apecoin community, and marketing efforts including giveaways for buyers with $APE.

The total amount requested from the ApeCoin Ecosystem Fund is $135,460 USD, paid in ApeCoin. This includes costs for plushies, books, illustrations, NFC tags, DApp development, marketing, and other expenses like handling, testing, and publication fees.

Gross revenue from product sales will be shared back to the DAO, with a minimum estimated return of $35,000 USD and a maximum potential return of $50,000 USD. The proposal includes quarterly reports on progress, updates for the community, and no user costs or premium features associated with using the DApp. There are no specific steps needed by the Foundation.

BuildrMetrics, a platform that simplifies liquidity provision for retail and institutional users, has proposed a governance plan for QuickSwap. They believe that QuickSwap V3 can overtake Uniswap V3 on the Polygon PoS network within six months, given the right implementations. The proposal aims to build advanced Constant Liquidity Pools (CLP) tools for the top 3 QuickSwap networks, which could increase liquidity and volume on the DEX. Jake Call, BuildrMetrics Founder, has written a detailed plan for this collaboration. A Snapshot vote is ongoing until April 10, 2023, for the community to decide on the proposal. The discussion can be found on QuickSwap's Reddit forum.

The text discusses proposed changes for Cake, a cryptocurrency platform, due to dissatisfaction with Chef Mochi and the team's decisions regarding Hops. Key proposals include:

1. Eliminating the 2% flexible fee considered a waste.
2. Following a model where farmers earn revenue instead of receiving free cake for dumping.
3. Distributing earned revenue to users who stake for at least a year, with additional rewards up to 4 years.
4. Minimal minting or none at all, to pay stakers only.
5. Launching on zksync and abandoning Polygon due to Sandeep's 50% equity in Quickswap, perceived as an obstacle for success.
6. Reducing the total supply of Cake from 500m to 300m or adjusting tokenomics.
7. Developing a gaming platform, such as poker, where the table takes 10% and burns the rest in prizes. Users can only join with Cake, but the platform allows converting other tokens to Cake, increasing buy pressure and burn. This aims to become the Zynga of crypto.

The 16th Special Voting Cycle commences on November 23rd at 19:00 GMT and concludes on December 16th at the same time. For a non-grant proposal to advance to a vote, approval from four top 100 delegates is required on the discussion thread. Delegates cannot approve their own proposals. Proposals initiated by the Foundation do not require delegate approvals and will automatically move to a vote. The voting process takes place through the Optimism Governance Portal. Eligible proposals for this cycle include Security Council Vote #2: Member Ratification and Upgrade #2: Canyon Upgrade.

The Uniswap Arbitrum Grant Program (UAGP) has released a mid-year report, highlighting key learnings and participant feedback from the program. The survey received 9 responses with an average satisfaction rating of 9.2/10. Communication and responsiveness were identified as strengths, with respondents giving an average rating of 9.7 out of 10 for responsiveness. The UAGP has learned several valuable lessons in managing a cross-ecosystem grant program, including adjusting reporting processes to better align with the nature of the grants, initiating a Grant Program alignment group to streamline cross-ecosystem collaboration and communication, and simplifying application forms based on applicant feedback. The UAGP encourages prospective builders to apply through their updated application link, which has changed since the last update.

The 1inch DAO generates revenue in USDC through the Swap Surplus collector, with the majority of the surplus being converted to USDC and deposited into the 1inch Network DAO Treasury. The 1INCH token was launched on December 23, 2020, and has since accumulated over $250B in trading volume with nearly 3M users.

The 1INCH token is an ERC-20 token with governance influence held by around 88,475 wallets, while the staked INCH token, st1INCH, used for governance is held by approximately 5,391 wallets. The 1inch Foundation, which holds a significant amount of 1INCH tokens, has transferred out most of its holdings and currently holds around $15M worth of the token.

There have been several audits of the 1INCH smart contract available on Github. On April 6, 2022, the 1inch Foundation burned the mint function of 1INCH.

This text discusses the maturity profile of DAI, a decentralized stablecoin, and suggests a model for understanding its distribution across different time horizons. The model reveals that 50% of outstanding DAI is on "long" maturity (above 3-months), which aligns with the assumption that a portion of DAI should always be easily unwindable. However, it also shows that the short-term front of DAI maturity is quite volatile, with more than 20% DAI having a maturity below one day and up to 40% over 1-week.

The text outlines potential solutions to manage these fluctuations, such as automating money markets D3M withdrawal when liquidity gets low, using held ETH or other major crypto-assets to source liquidity on money markets, generating yield from PSM assets, partnering with other stablecoin issuers for bilateral credit lines, and utilizing tokenized treasury Bonds.

The text also acknowledges known limitations of the model, such as not taking into account circular DAI, unequal risk of outflow in different smart contracts, considering smart wallets as smart contracts but possibly behaving like EOA (Externally Owned Account), and assuming a business-as-usual context without strong defiance of DAI during market crashes.

In conclusion, the text proposes a transparent and reproducible methodology for analyzing DAI maturity profiles and suggests maintaining at least 50% of outstanding DAI in medium-term maturity assets (unwindable within 1-year), 40% unwindable within a week, and 20% unwindable within a day. The model is based on historical data, so it should be considered as a business-as-usual scenario, and emergency scenarios requiring liquidation of assets with potential losses should also be planned for.

100 DIGG from the treasury is proposed for a redemption pool for the rebase options initiative, accounting for approximately 6% of the total DIGG supply. The amount may fluctuate due to potential rebases.

The provided text discusses an upcoming upgrade to the governance system of the 0x Protocol, a decentralized exchange standard. This upgrade aims to shift the governance from a current system to a fully on-chain system.

The table summarizes various meta governance variables and their proposed initial values:

1. Voting power: Determined by treasury = quadratic protocol = 1:1
2. Voting delay: 2 days for both Treasury and Protocol
3. Voting period: 7 days for both Treasury and Protocol
4. Proposal threshold: Square root of 250k for Treasury, 1M for Protocol
5. Quorum: 10% for Treasury, 10M for Protocol
6. Timelock: 2 days for Treasury, 3 days for Protocol

The current governance system using the 0x V3 staking pool contract will be decommissioned, and a migration path will be provided for ZRX holders. An audit of the proposed smart contracts has been scheduled, and the technical solution will be open-sourced on GitHub.

A three-step migration plan is proposed: deployment of new governance smart contracts, a buffer period for community transition, and a vote to switch the governance system.

Two critical security measures are highlighted:

1. 0x Protocol Security Council: A group with limited but impactful power over 0x Protocol to address any vulnerabilities that may arise.
2. Bug Bounty: Continuation of the current bug bounty program for 0x Protocol V4, which offers rewards up to $1,000,000 for critical exploits in 0x Protocol.

The goal is to decentralize the governance of 0x Protocol and make it uncensorable and unstoppable. The successful transition to on-chain governance will be a significant milestone in the decentralization roadmap of 0x Protocol.

The Uniswap Delegate Reward Initiative - Cycle 2 is accepting applications from candidates for a week, ending on August 27th at 9PM EST. Applicants must specify whether they are individuals or entities, with only one person per entity eligible to apply. After the deadline, reviewed applications will select top candidates during the ongoing onchain vote. The application template requires applicant name, type (individual or organization), link to Tally onchain voting profile, a summary of why they want to participate, dates and links of first offchain and onchain Uniswap votes made, RFC passage history, and participation in Uniswap Gov Workshop and Community Calls.

The RwaUrn contract allows users to draw Dai, but the Dai can only be sent to a specific outputConduit address defined during deployment. The RwaToken contract is a simple implementation of the ERC20 token standard with three functions: transfer, transferFrom, and approve.

The RwaConduit contract has one function, push(), which can be called by anyone with a current MKR balance and holds transitory funds. However, for centrifuge assets, a different contract (the centrifuge manager) acts as the compliant RwaConduit. The MIP21 construction has low technical risk but there may be unknown technical risks in the details of tinlake liquidations.

The ERC20 functions of the RwaToken are implemented to industry standard, but do not mitigate the allowance race-condition or use a SafeMath library. The core functions of the contracts are very limited and only governance or trusted addresses can lock, free, draw, or wipe Dai in the RwaUrn.

The ERC20 token contract does not inherit other contracts. The RwaToken file has an SHA-1 hash of df9d2a7f8f594fced88b457aa003100c347ace31 and the RwaConduit file is not used for centrifuge assets, but rather the centrifuge manager contract acts as a compliant RwaConduit. The core functions of the contracts have minimal ability and are restricted to governance or trusted addresses.

The PEEL and SHELL Syrup Pools are reward systems on the PancakeSwap platform, a decentralized exchange (DEX) built on the Binance Smart Chain (BSC). Users can stake CAKE tokens to earn PEEL or SHELL tokens.

- **PEEL**: The total supply is 7,500,000 PEEL, and it will be distributed over a period of 60 days starting shortly after the Initial Farm Offering (IFO) ends. The rewards per block are 4.340 PEEL. For the first 5 days, only users with an active PancakeSwap Profile can stake in the IFO Syrup Pool. After that, there is no requirement for a PancakeSwap Profile. The maximum stake per wallet is 100 CAKE for the first 5 days, then unlimited thereafter to ensure high APY for all participants.

- **SHELL**: The total supply is 155,000,000 SHELL, and it will also be distributed over a period of 60 days starting shortly after the IFO ends. The rewards per block are 89.699 SHELL. Similar to PEEL, for the first 5 days, only users with an active PancakeSwap Profile can stake in the IFO Syrup Pool. After that, there is no requirement for a PancakeSwap Profile.

To host these Syrup Pools, PancakeSwap will provide PEEL-BUSD and SHELL-BUSD farms with specific CAKE rewards. The PEEL farm will have 2x CAKE rewards for the first 48 hours and thereafter 1x CAKE rewards. The SHELL farm will have 0.5x CAKE rewards for the first 48 hours and thereafter 0.1x CAKE rewards.

The PEEL and SHELL tokens are related to the MetaApes game, which can be downloaded on iOS and Android devices. Users are advised to beware of potential scams, as only the official token contracts should be used. The PEEL official token contract address is: https://bscscan.com/token/0x734548a9e43d2D564600b1B2ed5bE9C2b911c6aB, and the SHELL official token contract address is: https://bscscan.com/token/0x208cfEc94d2BA8B8537da7A9BB361c6baAD77272.

Users are advised to do their own research and invest with caution, as all projects on the platform are subject to high market risk and volatility. PancakeSwap will not be held responsible for any investment losses.

1. Holographic Consensus: Implement a system where token holders at large, through direct or delegated votes, signal which proposals are worthy of discussion and voting. This would streamline the process by reducing the number of proposals to read/vote on, encouraging participation.

2. Rules of Continuation/Expiry: Implement sunset clauses (X percent votes for it) or auto-proceed clauses (X percent votes against it) to decide the next steps in incremental decentralization.

3. Consider Employee Interests: The balance achieved in the "decentralization" should reflect the interests and expectations of employees as well, who may not be token holders or in management positions but contribute significantly to the organization.

4. Design System Against Attacks: Compare and discuss potential attacks on the system and design from worst-case scenarios to achieve an acceptable balance for both founders and the community.

5. Incentivize Meaningful Voter Participation: Test novel ways to incentivize voter participation, such as Token Curated Registries, offering financial rewards or access to exclusive products/badges/POAPs/NFTs, gamifying voting using elements from the octalysis framework, and creating a tiered system.

6. Other Focused Discussions:
   - The Future of the Charter: Decide whether to adapt the charter to fit decentralization proposals, update it, or start anew.
   - Treasury Control and Swiss Tax Authorities: Address concerns about transferring significant amounts and potential tax implications.
   - Risk of Unlimited Liability: Discuss the risk of unlimited liability without a DAO legal wrapper and possible solutions.
   - AA Committee Binding Decisions: Establish consequences if the will of the community is not respected by the AA Committee.
   - Funding Request Prioritization: Determine how funding requests will be prioritized, such as first come first served or a prioritization vote mechanism.
   - Aragon Court and ANT Staking: Clarify how staked ANT in the Aragon Court is handled, whether it can be used in voting, and if it gets a special weight.
   - AAMA Membership and Governance: Discuss the potential of using AAMA membership to elect members of the AA and control the treasury, and whether this would satisfy the need for "decentralization" as an intermediate step.

The proposal introduces veCAKE, a system designed to enhance governance influence for CAKE holders, boost liquidity across pools, and increase rewards for stakers on PancakeSwap. veCAKE holders can direct gauge emissions, impacting how CAKE emissions are distributed within each pool, and delegate voting rights to third-party protocols. The system will be launched in phases, starting with all liquidity pools on BNB Chain, Ethereum, and Arbitrum, with other chains added later.

Initially, the total rewards available for farm emissions will be approximately 0.99 CAKE/block, taken from existing CAKE Syrup Pool and Farm Emissions. The Kitchen proposes to retain a 40% voting share of total veCAKE votes currently allocated to these farms, with the aim of ensuring a smooth transition and maintaining sufficient incentives for core liquidity pools.

The Kitchen will distribute its share of votes based on principles such as ensuring competitive returns for core liquidity pools and meeting existing Syrup Pool partner arrangements. If the gauge voting results do not significantly affect core liquidity pools, the Kitchen will abstain from voting or vote in alignment with existing votes. Over time, the Kitchen aims to reduce its management of CAKE emissions as veCAKE participants become familiar with the process. The proposal will be enacted and veCAKE launched after community approval, with a comprehensive FAQ provided for CAKE holders on participating in veCAKE and voting gauges.

Title: DAO Payment Escrow with Aragon Court Arbitration Proposal

   Description: RaidGuild is proposing to create a disputable escrow tool for DAOs, using Aragon Court for arbitration. The tool will minimize risk for all parties involved in freelancing cooperatives by depositing client funds into an escrow contract and releasing them as project milestones are reached. In case of disputes over deliverables, a dispute can be raised for alternative dispute resolution (ADR) providers to block or unlock funds.

   Stages: The proposal has two stages - Design & Research (2-3 weeks) and Build & Ship (4-6 weeks). The team aims to understand the Aragon Court codebase in the first stage, followed by implementation of the design in the second stage.

   Team: The team includes experienced smart contract writers, web3 application builders, DAO designers, and legal experts.

   Funding: The proposal requires 200 ANT for Design & Research and 300 ANT for Build & Ship. The funds will be used to reimburse the team members for their time spent on researching, designing, and building the disputable escrow service.

   Rationale: The proposal benefits DAOs that sell services by enabling them to enter into more trusted relationships with clients, and ANT/ANJ holders & the Aragon ecosystem by creating a new channel for demand for and adoption of Aragon Court.

The text discusses a proposal for integrating Amulet V2, a Web3 platform offering yield opportunities with risk management strategies, into Lido. Amulet V2's key features include curated yield opportunities, transparent risk profiles, built-in loss protection, and efficient claim handling.

The vault feature allows users to deposit assets for yield generation through various Web3 protocols. The Yield Vault offers selected yield opportunities with advanced strategies, a transparent risk profile, and inherent loss protection.

Lido is proposed as an integration partner for expanding yield strategies. Through Lido's Liquid Staking strategy, user-staked assets are channeled to the Lido Staking Pool, increasing TVL. Amulet provides coverage for these assets in case of various risks such as security, market, and operational risks.

The proposal seeks input from Lido regarding potential joint marketing initiatives, support, and recommending TVL to stake through Amulet into Lido. The proposal was written by a member of the Amulet team, is under CC0 copyright, and contacts can be found on Telegram.

The Curve DAO is seeking feedback on its initial proposal for creating a Compound-enabled Curve pool. Discussions include vote locking boost for COMP rewards, potential withdrawal admin fee to burn CRV, and the application of these rules.

1. Key Market Statistics:
   - Top 10 Borrowers' Aggregate Positions & Borrow Usage: Monitor the total borrowed amount, collateral ratio, and individual positions of the top 10 borrowers.
   - Top 10 Borrowers' Entire Supply: Keep track of the total supply of assets provided as collateral by the top 10 borrowers.
   - Top 10 Borrowers' Entire Borrows: Monitor the total amount borrowed by the top 10 borrowers.

2. Liquidations:
   - Analyze liquidation events due to price fluctuations, focusing on the collateral asset and borrowed assets involved, the amount of supply liquidated, and the repaid borrows.
   - Monitor liquidation trends over time, such as frequency, causes, and impact on market stability.

3. Liquidations and Repaid Borrows in the past month:
   - Review the number and amount of liquidations and repaid borrows that have occurred in the last month.
   - Identify any patterns or trends in these events, such as which assets are most frequently involved in liquidations and why.

4. Next Steps:
   - Propose recommendations based on the analysis of market statistics and liquidation events.
   - These recommendations will be put up for a VIP vote, with approval being subject to the terms of service available at gauntlet.network/tos.

Title: The Physical Resilience Scope Framework
   Summary: This Multi-Input Proposal (MIP) establishes a framework for physical resilience within the MakerDAO ecosystem. It outlines key principles, rules, and regulations, including legal research, regulatory strategy, privacy research, physically resilient collateral research, defensive stance parameter adjustments, and more. The framework also defines the Physical Resilience Advisory Council, a group responsible for improving the content of the physical resilience scope, and details their roles, responsibilities, and funding mechanisms. The framework can be amended through a specified process.
The text requests rational answers to be provided below. It does not provide specific information, so a summary is not applicable.

Title: Procedure for introducing Starknet breaking changes

Author: @amanusk
Status: Draft
Type: Standards Track
Creation date: July 4, 2024

This document outlines a process for proposing, discussing, and implementing core updates with breaking changes in the Starknet protocol. Every update must start as a SNIP, followed by community discussion and voting on the proposed changes. Breaking changes will be coupled to a Starknet version, requiring a community vote for versions with significant changes. A timeline is provided for discussing, reviewing, and implementing breaking changes, while allowing for agility through a "fast track" process for non-breaking changes. Roles and responsibilities are defined for SNIP Editor, Proposer, Developer, and User. The document follows the guidelines of RFC 2119 and RFC 8174.

1 Million Sushi tokens are being offered by SBF for encouraging staking migration, and it's suggested to contribute an equal amount from the Sushi Treasury. A vote is needed to decide the matching level.

A Service Provider (SP) is an entity with a budget, managed by one or more Leaders, working towards long-term goals in the Balancer Ecosystem. The community expects a minimum proposal structure including SP name, leader details, adherence to standards, domains of operation, key objectives, length of engagement and budget, ETH receiving address, and SLA link (if through Foundation/Opco).

SPs must abide by the DAO's code of conduct and accountability guidelines. Domains of operation may include areas like core protocol development, partner integrations, marketing, business development, front end, community, etc. Key objectives should be high-level goals with success metrics for evaluation. The budget overview explains how funds will be spent, with an estimate of monthly spend for quarterly fund distribution. Additional information, standards, and potential overlap are also considered to ensure efficiency and coordination within the ecosystem.

This text introduces the Venus community forum with guidelines for user behavior. The rules include: no spam, advertising, self-promotion, copyright infringement, offensive content, cross-posting of questions, or disrespect towards other members or admins.

Proposal to implement a Stableswap gauge for mBTC/WBTC on Ethereum, with a 0.02% fee tier, is being proposed by Babypie. mBTC is a cross-chain wrapped token pegged to native BTC and can only be minted by depositing BTC into Babypie. Users cannot earn rewards by simply holding mBTC. The goal is to build liquidity for the mBTC-WBTC pair on Ethereum through incentives via Cakepie Voting Market.

Details include a 1.00x boost multiplier and a 2% emission cap, with audits conducted by Supremacy, PeckShield, and AstraSec. mBTC holders can utilize their tokens in DeFi and earn yield once the Babylon staking protocol is launched on Mainnet. The control of the contract lies with a 3/6 multisig.

The proposal aims to attract new DAO onboarding through TVL, incentives for voters via Cakepie, trading fees, and volume. Token trackers on Etherscan show updated information, analytics, and historical data for mBTC, WBTC, and the liquidity pool address on PancakeSwap.

For more information, visit Magpie's website, social media platforms, or documentation provided by Babypie. The Github is not public, but additional relevant links can be found on Babypie's Medium page.

Title: AstarStats - Statistic & Visualization Tool on Astar Network Blockchain

   Overview: AstarStats is a tool designed for visualizing and supporting financial trading opportunities within the Astar Network's blockchain.

   Key Features:
   1. Data aggregation and visualization from Astar Network's blockchain.
   2. Daily transaction count, cumulative transaction count, daily gas used, unique contracts deployed, and developers.
   3. Smart contract visualization.
   4. Profit and loss visualization.
   5. Whale movement linked to Twitter.
   (More features will be added.)

   Team: An anonymous team with over 6+ years of experience in the analytics industry. The team consists of a founder with 6+ years of data science and analytics experience, and a lead developer with expertise in IoT stats monitoring service.

   Additional Information: Code is still under development, but can be shared upon request. MVP has been completed.

   Connect: Twitter - @AstarStats | Github - AstarStats

The text discusses the author's experience with a cryptocurrency operation involving multiple transactions during fund migration from sUSD pool to 3pool. They find it challenging to estimate the number and cost of these transactions, as well as understanding that the "Estimated tx cost" box indicates the next transaction cost, not the overall price. The author suggests implementing a modal pop-up that lists all upcoming transactions, explains the workflow, and provides an estimated gas cost for each transaction, with the primary focus on informing users about the number of approvals required to complete their operation. This modal would close once all transactions are completed. The purpose is to present necessary information at the right moment without cluttering existing pages.

The analysis discusses the status of the Morpho Spark DAI Vault, focusing on individual user and market metrics, as well as potential future scenarios. It is noted that users generally prefer USDe over sUSDe exposure due to higher incentives, but this trend may change with more time, liquidity, or reallocation of incentives.

The analysis also highlights a relatively low concentration of borrowers, well-collateralized positions, and a median health factor of 1.13 across all markets. The scenario analysis suggests that Maker can sustainably cover bad debt up to 20% haircuts for any given exposure level up to $1B through the surplus buffer and protocol owned liquidity.

Future plans include developing an Allocation Framework for Maker governance to make more informed decisions about DAI allocation, adding new metrics to the Morpho Spark DAI Vault section of the Block Analitica Morpho Dashboard, and actively working to re-underwrite USDe exposure by requesting a formal bug bounty and responsible disclosure program.

Their values include consistency, integrity, community-centric approach, sustainability, thoughtful decision-making, transparency, constructive criticism, and they will communicate their voting rationale and important updates within this thread.
