Title: Treasury Policy Amendment Proposal for Stablecoin Holding Requirement

The Badger Treasury is facing a shortage of Stablecoins. To comply with the current policy of maintaining one year's worth of operating expenses in Stablecoins, the Treasury may need to either sell its bullish assets (BTC, ETH, BADGER) or borrow Stablecoins against these assets. Both options are undesirable due to potential losses from selling and high fees associated with borrowing.

To improve capital efficiency, a proposal has been made to reduce the Stablecoin holding requirement from one year to one quarter. This change aims to continue the Treasury's strategy of spending Stablecoins on development while preserving its core volatile crypto assets. Rebalancing could interfere with eBTC launch plans and limit the Treasury's growth potential.

Implementation would require maintaining a minimum of three months' worth of operating expenses at all times, with an additional one month buffer each time replenishment occurs to avoid frequent transactions. The vote on this proposal is currently 1500Badger, adcv, Freddy The Filosopher, Po, saj in favor and gosuto, petrovska against.

The Aragon Shield Foundation is a trusted institution overseeing the Aragon Project, supervised by the Swiss foundation supervisory authority. It provides services to protect the Aragon Project and participants in the Aragon DAO. The foundation appoints and removes Guardians through the Aragon Shield Multisig, which also sets the parameters of the Guardian DAO.

Guardians have permissions to pause or veto Aragon DAO proposals based on pre-defined criteria. There are two types of Guardians: Tech Guardians and Legal Guardians, each with specific roles.

Tech Guardians review Ethereum proposals for potential malicious activity, ensure the proposal's description matches its transaction output, and veto any proposal without a sufficient description.

Legal Guardians oversee proposals submitted to the Aragon DAO, vetoing any that finance illegal activities, involve sanctioned individuals or entities, or could result in the ANT token being classified as securities or the Aragon DAO engaging in regulated activities under Swiss financial market laws. They also ensure financial proposals have filled out the Financial Compliance Form.

Voting in the Aragon DAO involves a delay period and a voting period. During the delay period, locked ANT cannot be slashed; it is simply locked and returned when the period expires. Anyone with wANT or delegated by another Ethereum address with wANT can vote during the 7-day voting period. wANT holders can override their delegate's vote at any time during the voting period.

A snapshot is taken at the beginning of the vote period, capturing the voting power of ANT Holders and Delegates. Votes are binary (Yes/No). A vote passes when the minimum participation and level of support in the parameters are met after the 7-day voting period.

Once a vote passes and the proposal has an associated on-chain action, any Ethereum address can execute it, paying the associated gas fees. The Voting App is used to execute proposals and filter based on enacted, passed, pending, and rejected statuses.

This text outlines a methodology for onboarding and allocating AVS (Asset Validator Shares) in the ether.fi platform, which is different from liquid staking tokens due to certain constraints. The methodology aims to minimize risks to the ether.fi protocol and eETH holders while optimizing for risk-adjusted return.

Key aspects of the methodology include:

1. Initial Distribution: Based on the amount of security required, identify the optimal distribution to minimize dependencies without rebalancing.
2. NO Share Limits: Set caps to ensure that no single Node Operator's (NO) share exceeds a specified percentage, starting at 15%. Over time, this cap should be reduced to further diversify and decentralize.
3. AVS Share Limits: Similarly, set caps for AVS shares, with a lenient cap initially and aiming to reduce it below 20% as more AVSs are onboarded.
4. Qualitative Filters: Consider factors such as Compensation Feasibility (minimum Annual Percentage Rate), Opportunity Cost, Centralization Risks, and potential risks from inactivity or malfunction of any NO or AVS.

The methodology is designed to prevent scenarios that could put the protocol in a difficult future position given the long-term nature of AVS commitments. As the restaking industry evolves, changes will be incorporated into the AVS risk assessment as they become known and measurable.

The text introduces a decentralized financial product distribution platform called Verso, which aims to connect traditional and cryptocurrency-based financial institutions with their respective audiences. The platform uses proprietary smart contracts for various financial product categories, eliminating the need for bilateral agreements between providers and third parties.

Verso is designed to address the issue of high costs and time constraints associated with integrating financial products across multiple partners like e-wallets, commerce platforms, and digital banks. The platform serves as a single access point for product providers to reach new consumers at minimal cost.

For traditional finance (TradFi), Verso assists insurers, lenders, and others in distributing their financial products globally, targeting specific consumer groups, facilitating crypto-fiat payments, and ensuring regulatory compliance. For decentralized finance (DeFi), Verso helps scale DeFi products to non-crypto natives through a network of TradFi partners, making it simple to embed DeFi products into the user journey of banks, digital wallets, and commerce platforms.

The platform ensures compliance, consumer protection, and smooth settlements between fiat currencies and cryptocurrencies. The text concludes by providing a link to Verso's documentation for further reading.

Author: @DigiFT

Summary: This proposal suggests that Aave invest a portion of its treasury's stablecoin holdings in low-risk RWAs, specifically U.S. Treasury bills, through DigiFT. The investment aims to diversify the portfolio and mitigate risk from high-volatile crypto assets. Investing via DigiFT, a compliant DEX, offers T+3 settlement, liquidity due to the liquid T-bill secondary market, and daily proof of reserve.

DigiFT's U.S. Treasury Token (DUST token) is a fully regulatory-compliant U.S. T-bill token, backed by single US T-notes with different maturities. The Aave community can choose specific T-bills or a basket of T-bills with different maturity. Investors can redeem during the remaining tenure of the T-bills or hold to maturity.

Benefits of considering DUST include liquidity, simple structure, regulatory compliance, and daily proof of reserve. DigiFT also offers other fixed-income products like high-quality bank bonds.

The proposal suggests a comfortable amount of 3M USDC for investment in DUST. The team is open to discussions and a community call to discuss this proposal and related topics like using RWA as collateral for the stable coin, GHO.

DigiFT was founded in 2020 and is enrolled within the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) FinTech Regulatory Sandbox. It provides regulatory-compliant services for primary market origination and distribution as well as secondary market trading of asset-backed tokens.

Title: Collateral Onboarding Oracle Assessment for GNO (MIP10c3-SP23)

   Overview: Proposal for an oracle to provide the GNO/USD price during collateral onboarding process in GNO. The oracle utilizes a mix of USDT, ETH, and direct-to-USD pairings to minimize quote manipulation due to low volume of the token.

   Data Model: Binance for GNO/USDT, Balancer, Kraken, Uniswap V3 for GNO/WETH, GNO/XBT, GNO/ETH respectively. ETH/USD and USDT/USD data models are also included for price reference.

   Oracle Supporting Data Model(s): ETH/USD (canonical) and USDT/USD.

   Oracle Address: Medianizer and Oracle Security Module addresses yet to be determined.

   Supported Tools: Setzer, Omnia, Gofer for GNO/USD, and their respective Goerli counterparts TBD.

   Rationale: Due to the low volume of GNO, the data model leans towards Automated Market Makers (AMMs) as price manipulation on them is quickly arbitraged by MEV bots and generally costs more transaction-wise than centralized exchanges. However, this makes the token problematic from an Oracle risk perspective, and it's recommended to take a subset of available price sources based on highest 24h volume, level of trust, and on-chain preference to reduce the risk of price manipulation while increasing the risk of source failure.

Title: Business Development Learning Experiment for Aragon Network

Objective: Conduct a learning experiment to help the Aragon network grow by understanding and assisting potential users who want to create Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs).

Proposed Action:
- Engage with 184 existing leads and new leads in Q1 2022.
- Categorize requests for better pre-qualification.
- Understand the timeline requirements of prospective DAOs.
- Qualify high-value and partnership-related leads.
- Track and share insights/user feedback from meetings.

Expected Outcomes:
- Determine the need, role, and possible impact of an Aragon Business Development Guild.
- Improve conversions from inbound lead to onboarded DAO.
- Identify ideal users for future products.

Requested Resources:
- $15,000 USD from January 17th through March 31st.
- Limited access to key Aragon members within the Product and Growth & Ecosystem teams.

Rationale: To capture valuable user insights that can help build better product experiences, create content relevant to users, and accelerate network growth.

Limitations and Risks:
- Lack of responsiveness due to volume.
- Infrastructure limitations for managing the inbound leads pipeline.

Duration, Deliverables, and Expected Outcomes:
- Bi-Weekly Business Development Pipeline Calls.
- Monthly Progress Reports on Aragon Forum.
- BD Q1 2022 Learnings Report.
- Growth in the number of DAOs/Users on the network.

Future Potential: Upon successful completion, design and launch the first iteration of the Aragon Business Development Guild.

BNB holders can stake their tokens on [pstake.finance](https://pstake.finance/) to earn stkBNB and use it within the BNB Chain DeFi ecosystem. The Syrup Pool offers CAKE token rewards for 60 days, with a total of 950,000 PSTAKE tokens distributed. Staking limits apply during the initial phase. In addition, v3 farms for stkBNB-BNB and PSTAKE-CAKE will be available on BNB Chain. The rewards multiplier may adjust at the end of the 60 days based on farm performance and safety considerations. pSTAKE is the governance token of pSTAKE Finance, while stkBNB represents staked BNB issued by pSTAKE. Users are advised to verify token addresses before buying tokens to avoid scams.

The text discusses proposals aimed at rescuing a project named Cake, due to perceived inadequacies from Chef Mochi and the team, specifically regarding the absence of Hops. Key suggestions include:

1. Eliminating 2% flexible fee, considered a waste.
2. Adopting a model like Joe's, where farmers don't receive cake for dumping but earn revenue, which goes to users who stake for at least a year.
3. Staking rewards should be the only source of minting new Cake tokens, with minimal or no additional minting.
4. Launch on zksync, abandoning polygon due to Sandeep's 50% equity in quickswap, perceived as hindering success.
5. Reducing the total supply or altering tokenomics, suggesting a maximum of 300m tokens could suffice.
6. Developing a gaming platform, possibly poker, with a 10% house edge and burning the proceeds, while rewarding players with Cake or converted tokens, aiming to become the Zynga of crypto.

The text presents a proposal to fund BlockScience, a team of data scientists and communicators, to evaluate the results of a 6-week Conviction Funding (CF) experiment. The goal is twofold: assess the suitability of Conviction Voting for larger systems and improve understanding of the Conviction Voting algorithm. The team will analyze the CF pilot data, present findings in python notebooks, and publish an executive summary on the Aragon forum. Team members include Michael Zargham (CEO), Andrew Clark (Data Scientist), and Jeff Emmett (Communications). They have experience with DAOs, detailed knowledge of Conviction Voting, and data science skills. The proposal requests 445 ANT (~$3600) to be transferred to the Ethereum address 0x422aE3412510d6c877B259DaD402dDEAF1fdb28e. The funds will be held by BlockScience and used to reimburse team members in fiat.

Proposal for a multi-reward pool (Cake Vault) where users who lock their Cake can earn tokens from various pools, increasing global APR, enabling Cake holders to diversify earnings, and encouraging longer locking periods. Rewards from other pools remain unlocked.

This text discusses a proposal to update four risk parameters for FEI on Aave V2 Ethereum, aiming to minimize potential exposure due to FEI's market volatility. The proposed changes include:

1. Lowering Liquidation Threshold (LT) and Loan-To-Value (LTV) to 1% and 0 respectively, preventing new borrowings against FEI and potentially limiting losses.
2. Raising the Liquidation Bonus (LB) from 6.5% to 10%, incentivizing liquidators for underwater positions.
3. Decreasing the UOptimal from 80% to 1%, increasing borrowing rates and encouraging loan repayment.

The proposal will be subjected to community feedback, followed by a snapshot vote and Aave Improvement Proposal (AIP) submission for implementation if consensus is reached. The text is under CC0 copyright license.

The Deploying American Blockchains Act was passed with a unanimous vote, signifying a significant step towards promoting the competitiveness of blockchain technology in the United States. This act directs the Department of Commerce to focus on the deployment, use, application, and competitiveness of blockchain technology.

In addition, various other bills related to DeFi, stablecoins, CBDCs, financial innovation, and digital assets are being considered by both chambers of Congress. These include but are not limited to H.R. 1122, H.R. 1747, H.R. 2670, H.R. 2891, H.R. 2969, H.R. 3572, H.R. 4664, H.R. 4763, H.R. 4766, H.R. 4841, H.R. 5403, H.R. 5741, H.R. 6307, H.R. 6322, H.R. 6572, S. 661, S. 695, S. 1357, S. 2226, S. 2281, S. 2355, S. 2597, S. 2669, S. 3087, and S. 3441.

The DeFi community is actively engaging with Congressional offices and policymakers, providing insights into the foundational aspects of the technology and advocating for policies welcoming of DeFi and DAOs. This engagement is helping to shape a better, more open future for DeFi.

BoredIn is an independent organization within the Ape community, founded by @popilart and @NFThoarder888. It focuses on IP research and event planning, hosting live events, newsletters, and brunch events. The goal is to build a collaborative community similar to LinkedIn for apes, with over 200 members. They aim to expand the reach of MBA brands and products through various platforms like X, Linkedin, and YouTube. The BoredIn Weekly newsletter and live spaces help in this expansion. Their website features an MBAs Research Tag, focusing on inbox subscriptions and eCommerce promotion. They plan to continue growing and building the MBA ecosystem with other talented builders. Follow BoredIn at Twitter @BoredInApe and visit their website www.boredin.news.

The July 2021 Real-World Finance Core Unit report indicates no changes from the previous month in their strategy. The goal is to onboard $300M of real-world assets, with a two-pronged approach: partnering with Centrifuge for smart contract investments and exploring Trust-based methods using MakerDAO balance sheet. They aim to build a strong capital base and increase market recognition of MakerDAO's financial strength to boost the MKR price.

The report mentions an ongoing RWA pipeline, including potential partnerships with various entities such as Nebula Capital Partners, CapitalNow Cannabis, Cauris Global Fintech, 120dB Films, Untangled Finance, and more. The main challenge remains in establishing legal structures.

Financially, the unit is not yet profitable but generating cash flows, with some needed Core Units still missing. Research efforts are focused on creating and improving legal structures for RWA, securitization strategies, and data infrastructure.

The report also highlights ongoing projects like RealDAO, data warehousing tools, and a Cayman Foundation structure. The team composition includes full-time and part-time members working on various aspects of the project. The Core Unit budget is managed through a multisig wallet. Previous reports are available for reference.

The text is a reminder to the ApeCoin DAO Community about guidelines for engagement on their forum. Members are encouraged to maintain a productive and inclusive environment by keeping threads on topic and flagging posts deemed inappropriate or off-topic. Flagged posts will be addressed by Forum facilitators anonymously, with three flags triggering immediate action. The text emphasizes the importance of using the flagging feature instead of engaging in off-topic exchanges within a thread. The community's daily contributions are appreciated, and the goal is to continue discussions productively.

GaiaStarter is a platform on the AstarNetwork, built on Polkadot, that assists projects in raising funds through IDO (Initial Dex Offering) and INO (Initial NFT Offering). It's the first platform on AstarNetwork to support INO. The platform allows participants to stake stable coins like USDC, aUSD, or SAI for IDO token allocation and rewards. For creators wishing to launch NFTs on AstarNetwork, an INO platform and NFT staking functionality are available.

Key features include:
- Stable coin usage in IDO participation
- Earning both IDO token allocation and IDO tokens as staking rewards
- An NFT creator from Japan designed the platform's web top
- Support for INO and NFT staking to increase TVL (Total Value Locked) on AstarNetwork
- Staking pools for $SAI, stable coins, and IDO allocation/tokens

The team consists of global members in various roles. The platform has over 1600 community members. GaiaStarter's roadmap includes soft launch, token launch, farming, and CEX listing milestones.

The text discusses a community discussion topic concerning Lido's MEV (Maximal Extractable Value) policy, which is relevant in light of the upcoming Staking Router and DVT solutions like SSV and Obol. The discussion revolves around three main points:

1. MEV relay provider "allow-list"
2. Censoring vs. non-censoring MEV relays
3. Vanilla block building vs. MEV-boost enabled building

The author acknowledges the anticipated diversity of actors in Lido's operator set and suggests revisiting past work on MEV policy to align with the near-term composition of Lido and its long-term goals within the Ethereum ecosystem. The text also includes relevant forum threads, blog posts, and statements from SEC Commissioner Peirce and Coinbase regarding staking services for additional context. The regulatory/censorship risk is mentioned as a crucial aspect of the discussion, although it is suggested to postpone a thorough exploration of this topic for another thread if necessary.
The proposal suggests moving all Convex Sett emissions to blCVX, offering incentives such as fee and gas rebates for users migrating, and providing $200,000 in CVX for the bveCVX/CVX curve pool.

The text proposes a strategy to increase the value of a protocol (presumably a cryptocurrency) called CAKE. The idea is to reward holders of CAKE with a progressive percentage for holding and providing liquidity in pools or farms. This rewards system aims to add value and usage to the coin, incentivizing market makers to hold the token for increased profits in the swap of liquidity pools. The goal is to generate demand for the token and make it more useful. The author invites discussion on Instagram @Anarkobobo.

The roles of the Director, CEO/Management, Legal Counsel, Self Insurance, Bank Fees, Accounting Software, and Domain Hosting are outlined in this text.

The Director is responsible for bringing independent judgment to issues affecting the DAO, providing advice on all matters concerning the Company, planning its future strategic direction, and sharing responsibility with other directors for effective management. The CEO/Management is responsible for day-to-day management of the Foundation, including liaising with the board, managing finances, service providers, developing organizational goals, ensuring compliance, and overseeing vendors and software developments.

The Foundation may require advice on Cayman law from a legal counsel. Self Insurance is necessary due to the lack of reasonable insurance for organizations like this one, with a reserve of $500,000 set aside for potential legal costs. Bank Fees are an estimate/placeholder for monthly fees related to establishing a bank relationship. Accounting Software and Domain Hosting are included in the minor operating budget.

Proposal for CIP#7 admin fee distribution: Option 1 suggests buying CRV on the open market and giving it to veCRV holders. Option 2 proposes directing fees to a Curve pool, with veCRV holders receiving LP tokens instead.

Gauntlet has proposed incentive parameters for the USDC Native Comet Base, which includes daily COMP supply and borrow rewards. The current structure offers 20 COMP daily for supply rewards and 8 COMP daily for borrow rewards. These rewards aim to attract a significant inflow of supply tokens during the protocol's early stages.

Assuming full usage of supply caps and current liquidation factors, the total borrowing power would be approximately $11.9M. With a 60% borrow usage, the borrowing volume would be around $7.1M, leading to a supply volume of $13.9M.

With these assumptions and the present Interest Rate curve, the Supply APR is 2.25%, Borrow APR is 3.65%, Supply Distribution APR is 5.42%, and Borrow Distribution APR is 3.65%. This results in Net APRs of 7.67% for supply and 1.24% for borrow.

The current projected net APRs are within reasonable ranges, suggesting no immediate need for changes to the COMP rewards on the BASE v3 USDC comet if the community believes there is still growth potential in the comet.

The conversation revolves around Venus, a decentralized finance platform built on Binance Smart Chain. The new team members, 0x_bh1 and kkirka, addressed concerns about the delay in launching a vault, which some believe could have prevented a drop in the price of Venus. They also discussed plans to add value to Venus through community grants, open new markets, and facilitating integrations with other protocols.

Regarding CZ's involvement, it was clarified that Binance is invested in the project but CZ does not personally invest or supervise any projects. The topic of a $15 million XVS buyback was brought up, with kkirka stating that it will not be happening due to concerns about price manipulation.

The VRT-XVS swap ratio was discussed, with the current ratio being 12,000:1. However, if XVS significantly increases in value without a corresponding increase in VRT, the ratio may need to be adjusted through a community vote.

Finally, the team expressed appreciation for the community's feedback and engagement, and encouraged everyone to submit their ideas and proposals. The conversation ended with kkirka thanking everyone for their questions and feedback.

Heimdall requires genesis parameters for each module and updates them as necessary without altering the genesis. The Cosmos-SDK uses its x/gov module to propose and change parameters at a specific block height, allowing nodes to vote on changes that take effect once a majority is reached. Unlike Cosmos-SDK, Heimdall's governance focuses solely on param changes rather than managing the entire system's governance aspects like checkpoints and exits. A proposed solution involves adopting Cosmos-SDK's params and governance module, with a 2/3+ majority required for approval. Simplifying Heimdall's governance by eliminating veto votes and complex delegation voting mechanisms is suggested to streamline the process.
A portion of Dice game profits contributes to buying back and burning Cake tokens, potentially increasing user engagement and product usage on the platform.
An individual vote was submitted past the May 27 deadline. The Token House will decide if it's acceptable. No further details provided.

The text discusses the role of Oxytocin (a delegate) in the governance of a decentralized platform, focusing on Season 3 - Cycle 10. The delegate intends to use a communication thread not only for vote announcements but also for discussing the reasoning behind these votes and metagovernance.

The delegate expresses concern about the sustainability of instant rewards in grant proposals, suggesting incentives for actions that lock capital for longer periods or foster better ecosystem synergies. They also support the Bedrock update, which they believe will improve Fraud Proofs and pave the way for decentralized sequencers and fraud proofs in future updates.

The delegate shares their experience with the Onchain Voting Beta, appreciating the ease of use and modification of the Delegate Commitment page, but expressing concern about delegate centralization due to the current sorting system. They propose solutions such as hiding delegation from results for delegates with more than a certain percentage of supply, introducing an age filter for delegates, and allowing citizen badgeholders to select recommended delegates.

Title: Add wstETH to Optimism Aave v3
   Summary: This ARFC proposes adding wstETH as collateral with borrowing enabled in the Optimism Aave v3 Liquidity Pool. The addition of wstETH is expected to create borrowing demand for wETH, boost Aave's revenue, and enable similar products on Optimism. Risk parameters have been provided by Gauntlet and Llama, and the proposal includes specific values for supply cap, borrow cap, LTV, LT, liquidation bonus, liquidation protocol fee, loan to value, liquidation threshold, borrow rates, and reserve factor. The proposal is supported by the success of stETH on Aave v2 Ethereum, which has generated significant revenue. Copyright: Creative Commons CC0.

Title: Orbit Program Renewal Proposal May 2024

   Date: May 13, 2024

   Author: Marc Zeller from Aave Chan Initiative (ACI)

   Summary: The proposal aims to renew the Orbit program for recognized delegates, compensating them with GHO and ETH reimbursement for gas costs associated with their governance activities. This compensation is intended to support delegates' focus on Aave and their continued contribution to our governance.

   Key Points:

   - The proposal extends Orbit for a new quarter, taking into account the transition to Governance V3 and its gasless voting feature via Gelato integration.
   - While general gas rebate programs may be discontinued, targeted gas rebates will be maintained for proposal creation and payload deployment activities.
   - Eligible platforms include EzR3al, Stable Labs, Saucy Block, and Areta.
   - The period covered is from Block 19162697 (5th Feb 2024) to Block 19860031 (May 13th 2024).
   - ACI and TokenLogic will receive 2.74 ETH and 0.641 ETH respectively for their governance-related activities.
   - The budget is 60000 GHO and 3.381 ETH.
   - Community feedback is sought, followed by a potential move to the ARFC snapshot stage and AIP stage if consensus is achieved.
   - The proposal is independent and does not involve any compensation from related parties.
The text suggests allowing CAKE token holders on the Binance Smart Chain network to exercise governance rights for one or more selected networks. Only BSC CAKE holders are currently eligible to vote.

This text discusses a public discussion section within the community staking module, primarily using the Lido Discord server for communication. The section aims to facilitate broader discussions visible to DAO members, allowing CSM participants to seek advice and guidance from the community.

The text discusses a governance election for the decentralized finance project, Sushi. The multi-sig wallet owners, nominated due to their contributions to the Sushi community, will oversee and manage various responsibilities such as organizing future votes, deploying contract changes, managing treasury, and grants. The elected multi-sig wallet owners may be replaced by a DAO mechanism in the future through a community vote. The election is open to $SUSHI-ETH LP (SUSHIPOWAH) stakeholders and the top 9 candidates will each hold one key, with 6 required to make changes to Sushi.

The text describes a governance election for the multi-sig wallet ownership of $SUSHI, a cryptocurrency. Nine candidates, including the CTO of FirstbloodIo and author of capitalgram.com, are participating in this election, which is open to any SUSHIPOWAH (Sushi-ETH liquidity provider) stakeholders. The elected multi-sig wallet owners will be responsible for managing future votes, deploying contract changes, managing treasury & grants, and potentially transitioning to a DAO mechanism subject to community vote. This election follows a promise made during the $SUSHI handover to SBF_Alameda.
The text describes a platform akin to Netflix, offering various games. Accessible via a monthly subscription using Cake currency.

PancakeSwap has introduced Syrup Pool for unshETH ($USH), a DeFi protocol that allows users to mint unshETH by depositing Liquid Staking Derivatives (LSDs). The goal is to improve validator decentralization among different Liquid Staking Protocols.

Stake CAKE tokens to earn USH tokens from the Syrup Pool with a total reward of 320,000 USH over 60 days starting on 25 Apr 2023. The maximum stake per wallet is limited for initial farming rewards at high APY.

In addition, unshETH-USDT and unshETH-USH farms will be available on BNB Chain with varying CAKE rewards during the 60-day period. The rewards may adjust after the period based on certain metrics.

unshETH is a diversified liquid staked ETH index available on ETH and BNB Chain, allowing users to mint unshETH by depositing supported LSDs like wstETH, cbETH, rETH, sfrxETH, and redeem a mix of the underlying LSDs. The team is also developing additional utilities for unshETH.

For more information on how to interact with unshETH, visit the official channels provided. Always verify the token address before buying tokens to avoid scams.

The text suggests improvements for Starknet's future airdrop rules. It proposes rewarding users based on their holding time and frequency of use, analyzing wallet transaction history and token holding time. It also emphasizes prioritizing rewards for those who participate in official activities, particularly those using STRK tokens. The author encourages a long-term investment approach by suggesting a holding reward program where the longer the token is held, the more rewards. Users depositing STRK tokens on platforms like zklend and Nostra for low returns are considered long-term supporters who deserve recognition and rewards. The author concludes by expressing hope that Starknet will consider these suggestions to create fairer and more effective airdrop rules in the future.

The proposal aims to integrate 1Hive's token request app with Aragon Connect. The integrator has previously worked on a similar project, NFT request, during Hack the World. The proposed work includes creating a subgraph similar to The Graph protocol, enabling communities to incorporate governance into their dApps.

The integration could facilitate onboarding new token holders and managing DAO-owned NFT purchases and sales. dApps can customize their onboarding process and display their NFT gallery in an ecosystem-friendly manner. The expected duration is one month, with a budget of 200 ANT.

The integrator is a member of Raid Guild and has contributed to SourceCred and Metagame repositories recently. Their Ethereum address for fund transfer is provided. The funds will be used for compensation during the expected time of work and further improvements in the NFT Request repository.

2023 concluded with a challenging yet promising year for DeFi, particularly for Balancer, as the upcoming launch of v3 signals an exciting 2024. December was a busy month, marked by various developments. The Maxis proposed BIP-508 to utilize locked vlAura for ecosystem growth and incentivize high revenue pools. Arbitrum's STIP program saw suggestions for dynamic boosts to enhance its effectiveness. Collaboration with OpenBlock ensured accurate data evaluation for Arbitrum's STIP. The month also witnessed the best performance post-boosted pools hack, with significant bribes/fees distributed to veBAL holders and the DAO. A financial report was posted, providing an overview of the Treasury and DAO health.

Governance saw four active delegates, with BIP-513 seeding BAL liquidity on Avalanche and BIP-516 exiting from D2D/BAL pool. Ecosystem initiatives included the "Balancer Anti Scam Initiative" and a weekly newsletter. DAO development work focused on creating a voting incentives simulator 2.0, while user/project support remained active on Telegram chats.

Gauges and governance support saw numerous updates, including enabling new gauges for various tokens and pools across different networks. The USDC budget report was finalized, with remaining funds rolled over to Q1'24 budget.

Effective immediately, trading fees of 0.04% are being distributed between liquidity providers and veCRV holders. This distribution is part of a community-led proposal that will distribute over $20M annually to veCRV holders. To start receiving your share of the fees, lock your CRV at [Curve DAO Locker](https://dao.curve.fi/locker). The current APY (Annual Percentage Yield) is 235%, based on today's trading volume. For more information, refer to the short guide at [Curve Resources](https://resources.curve.fi/guides/staking-your-crv).

The text discusses a proposal to increase the Perpetual (PERP) capitalization from $3 million, currently at $14 million and stable. The author suggests that due to recent events with Bitmex, there could be a shift in trading volume, and PERP, being the only USD-settled perpetual future on a DEX, could potentially capture this liquidity. The author emphasizes that PERP is unique as it provides USD-based perpetual futures contracts, differentiating it from other protocols like dYdX. The PERP token is also planned to distribute trading fees back to token holders, encouraging volume.

The project aims to be the first launchpad on the ASTAR network, aiming to bring 4-8 new protocols to expand the ASTAR ecosystem's Total Value Locked.

The team consists of Derek (co-founder and developer), Christopher (founder and CMO), Solomon (business development + marketing), JD (business development + CM + Discord expert), Junaid (business development), and Bella (content creator). PancakeSwap has announced a new Syrup Pool with APX Finance ($ALP) on opBNB. Title: Whitelist Set Protocol for UNI/USD Oracle Access

Author: Alex Soong
Status: Formal Submission

Proposal: To grant access to additional Maker oracles for Net Asset Value (NAV) issuance, specifically the UNI/USD Oracle. The customer is Alex Soong from Set Protocol. The contract source code has been verified on Etherscan and the data usage does not encourage parasitic behavior. No storage of Oracle data is required. Fees for the first year are waived, with subsequent fees to be determined by MKR Governance.

The text is an application request from the team behind liquidity.vision, a platform that provides a simple dashboard to track Balancer liquidity pool performance. They aim to use the requested grant money for server costs and development support. Their platform solves the problem of tracking liquidity pool performance by offering features like Impermanent Loss (IL/IG) calculation, fee earnings tracking, and more. The team consists of a developer named Tom and a member known as Dr. Eggplant. They plan to integrate other Automated Market Makers (AMMs), historical LP data, swap fees viewing, accurate IL calculator, farming rewards data, and token tracking for power farmers in the coming months. They hope to receive the grant to continue providing value to the Balancer ecosystem.

The text discusses two blockchain projects: PlasmaCash and Matic Network. PlasmaCash uses sparse Merkle trees, claimed to aid in fraud detection. Matic Network, on the other hand, appears to utilize regular Merkle tree proofs for scalability and security. However, no specific reasons were provided as to why Matic Network chose regular Merkle trees over sparse ones.

This text discusses a proposal for adjusting the interest rate model parameters within Venus Protocol for the listed cryptocurrencies: ADA, BCH, BETH, BTC, DOGE, ETH, FIL, LINK, LTC, SXP, XRP. The changes aim to optimize risk management, supply rates, and revenue by steepening interest rate model curves and adding kinks (rate jumps) for competitive supply rates and sufficient supplier withdrawal liquidity.

The Governance Fund Phase 1 proposal is eligible for voting in Cycle 8, marking the last Voting Cycle of Season 2. Two committees - DeFi Committee C and Shadow DeFi Committee B - have provided recommendations on this proposal. While DeFi Committee C is an official committee, Shadow DeFi Committee B is not, but their recommendations are posted online. The Token House, by approving committees, has entered a social contract to delegate decision-making to them. However, delegates may vote against the recommendation of official committees, but should provide a reason for doing so to the community.

The author, supportive of transitioning Aragon into a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO), shares their thoughts. They emphasize the importance of adhering to the Aragon Manifesto's values and believe that as pioneers of DAO tools, it is crucial for Aragon to embody the structure it promotes. The author highlights two changes they would have made in the past: starting later when DAOs gained momentum, and starting as a DAO themselves.

The author argues that transitioning to a DAO structure is necessary for Aragon to maintain its focus on building infrastructure for decentralized organizations. They also stress the need for urgency and flexibility in managing funds, citing Aragon's significant financial resources.

The author expresses concerns about potential threats, such as ensuring checks and balances to prevent misuse of funds, maintaining an inclusive culture, providing facilitation for the DAO, addressing the current ANT distribution, and recruiting top talent. They conclude by expressing gratitude for the community's efforts and wishing for continued growth in ways beyond their initial expectations.

Concordium Blockchain will integrate into Ethereum's ecosystem via the VEGA update, potentially enabling Compound DeFi protocol operation. Concordium is a science-backed public blockchain designed for privacy and accountability, featuring an ID layer that associates wallets with verified real-world identities through third-party providers, ensuring trust and privacy.

The text is a grant proposal submitted by Encode Club 3 for Apecoin to co-sponsor their upcoming four-week virtual hackathon, Future of Blockchain University. The event aims to introduce students to leading blockchain protocols, particularly Apecoin. The proposed sponsorship is for the Gold-tier package worth $25,000, which covers event organization, marketing, hiring support, and prizes for participants. Apecoin's involvement would include workshops and challenges with rewards. The proposal is available at this link: [AIP-273](https://forum.apecoin.com/t/aip-273-apecoin-to-co-sponsor-encode-s-upcoming-university-hackathon/12518). Title: Gauge Proposal for Manifold Finance Pool

Summary: The proposal aims to whitelist the Manifold Finance pool (50% FOLD / 50% WETH) on Balancer.fi. This pool has generated significant volume incentives and bribes, making it crucial for Manifold's growth at this stage.

Protocol Description: Manifold Finance provides access to high-value transaction pools through their infrastructure, SecureRPC, which aggregates multiple endpoints and maintains direct access to various mining pools/validator nodes.

Motivation: With current onchain liquidity at 300k and past volume incentives exceeding 4m$, deepening liquidity is key for Manifold.

Specifications:
- Governance: Utilizes an elected dictator system, with FOLD tokens delegating protocol control to one address (the dictator). Accounts can elect a new supreme dictator by removing their support and reallocating it towards a new address.
- Oracles: Not Applicable.
- Audits: Conducted and security issues handled through GitHub and Defi Threat Matrix.
- Centralization vectors: Utilizes Permissive Action List for partner integrations, with potential risks from GitHub deletion, Google Services, centralized Discourse forum, and certain account addresses holding large amounts of FOLD tokens.
- Market History: The pool has been active for 14 days, generating over 225k volume since inception, approximately 84k$ BPT with a current APR of 256% & fees of 1200$ in the past 24h.
- Value: While the majority of LP are on Sushiswap, this pool offers higher rewards and potential bribes, making it an attractive option.

This text is about the official Uniswap Governance Forums, a platform for discussions focused on governance-related topics such as governance proposals, proposal discussions, delegation pitches, and site feedback. It clarifies that the forum is not for UNI price discussions, generic Uniswap discussions, support requests, or off-topic conversations.

The forum provides resources like the Uniswap website, FAQ, documentation, GitHub, and Twitter. Common questions addressed include how to claim UNI, where to learn more about UNI, and where to vote for governance proposals.

A template is provided for structuring Uniswap proposals, including sections for title, author(s), related discussions, submission date, simple summary, abstract, motivation, specification & rationale, benefits, downside, voting, and updates.

The governance process involves submitting a forum post, discussing the proposal in community calls, creating a temperature check post with a snapshot vote, updating the temperature check post incorporating feedback, publishing a consensus check, escalating the proposal to an on-chain vote if certain UNI tokens are delegated, and staying updated through the community newsletter and Twitter Governance Bot.

The text discusses a proposed method for ANJ holders to redeem their locked ANT tokens. The process involves four main steps:

1. Signal intent: ANJ holders indicate their desire to redeem their ANT at a rate of 0.0015 ANJ per ANT by sending the desired amount of ANJ to a specified address.
2. Burn transactions collection: A script is run to gather all addresses and the ANJ they have burned, calculating the corresponding ANT balances for redemption.
3. Merkle distributor deployment: A Merkle distributor smart contract, similar to Uniswap's, is deployed with the calculated balances.
4. ANT distribution: The Community Multisig proposes minting and depositing the required ANT into the distributor contract, allowing users to claim their ANT.

The process will be repeated in batches over a period of one year to minimize friction for the Community Multisig. The proposal aims to provide quick redemption options for ANJ holders while saving time on smart contract creation and auditing. Further community feedback is sought before formally proposing this plan to the Community Multisig.

Additionally, a more complex process is being developed for redeeming ANJ in exchange for ANT with a one-year lockup, which will be released at a later date. The lockup rate is set to begin on October 5th, when the bonding curve was paused by the Aragon Network council.

The text discusses a collaboration proposal between Balancer and Sherlock, a DeFi insurance protocol. The goal is to insure Balancer pools using Sherlock's services, starting with one test pool and eventually covering all TVL (Total Value Locked) in Balancer contracts.

Sherlock aims to make DeFi safer for the average user by partnering directly with protocols, assessing their risks, and pricing insurance affordably. The proposal suggests that Balancer decides which risks it wants coverage for and how much coverage it needs. Sherlock will then price the coverage as a percentage of the value to cover and guarantee full payout on hacks in accordance with the chosen coverage.

The timeline for this collaboration includes Sherlock's mainnet launch within 6-8 weeks, followed by a test pool going live between May and June 2021. Balancer is asked for a grant of $10k to help build a dedicated security team for pricing Balancer's insurance and assessing its vulnerabilities/risks.

The team behind Sherlock includes Jack Sanford (Business Development/Full-stack), Evert Kors (Backend/Smart Contracts), and Vincent Schut (Frontend/Design). Their qualifications include experience in the financial sector, Solidity development, and frontend development respectively. Interested parties can find more information on Sherlock's GitHub, Twitter, or Telegram.

CapitalDAO is a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) investment firm specializing in cryptocurrency, built on Web 3.0 principles. The team has over 5 years of experience in the blockchain industry and remains anonymous.

The DAO operates using a Triple-Token model: CDS for accessing the Launchpad, CPDT for governance, and CPDP to share profits. Fundraising in September 2021 raised $8,732,979.63, with 60% allocated for investments.

Key features include building a VC 3.0 managed by DAO members, an equitable IDO platform, and a "DAO Worker" to boost DAOs and projects. The roadmap includes launching the Launchpad on Ethereum in April, followed by staking and farming features on Astar Network in Q2.

Future plans include multi-chain support, seed sale programs, and the launch of DAO Worker in Q4 2022. For updates, follow CapitalDAO on Linktree.

The proposal suggests adjusting parameters for a digital asset called VAI to maintain its value close to $1. This is achieved by increasing the steepness of the interest rate curve, making it more expensive to borrow VAI when its price is low and offering better rates when it's at $1. The baseRate has been reduced from 4% to 3%, while the floatRate has been increased from 225% to 4000%. This change may potentially reduce earnings if VAI remains at $1, decrease VAI borrowings, and Total Value Locked (TVL). However, this VIP does not currently enable VAI borrowing; it's contingent on having a substantial healthy buffer in the VAI USDT PSM.

While not all ideas will be implemented, the focus remains on changing the landing page.

The PCS team is suggested to modify the tokenomics mechanism, balancing emissions based on previous cycle burns. This adjustment would decrease APY to match burns, reducing inflation quickly. Higher burns increase APY, and vice versa. [Discussion](https://www.reddit.com/r/pancakeswap/)

The proposed change in bveCVX voting strategy involves selling bribes by default, with an option to switch to emissions if deemed necessary by the Council. Fees for vote weight will be distributed as follows: 5% for DAO operations, 5% for bveCVX/CVX LP emissions, and 5% for BADGER/WBTC CVX & CRV yield. Rewards from bribe selling will be divided into 75% bveCVX and 25% Badger. The bveCVX will continue to participate in the Boost as native balance and can also be used as collateral on Rari, maintaining its rewards and Boost power. The distribution of Badger and cvxCRV from the emissions schedule to bveCVX will stop unless it's cost-efficient to buy vote weight from it.

The text discusses a proposal to improve Uniswap governance by distributing more power to active yet underrepresented delegates. The proposal requests the Uniswap Foundation to delegate 2.5 million UNI each to four selected delegates who meet certain criteria, including an 80% participation rate and having a Delegate Platform on the Uniswap Forum. The delegates will serve for one year, and if removed before the term ends, their roles won't be filled. The aim is to increase governance activity, resilience, and robustness by encouraging more active participation from underrepresented delegates. The proposal also outlines participation requirements and application criteria for potential delegates. If passed, a 5-day application period will follow, with an additional vote if there are more than four qualified applicants. The term is one year, and the roles won't be filled if a delegate is removed before the end of the term.

Title: Pando 2.0 - A Decentralized Github

   Description: The initial version of Pando, a distributed remote protocol for git based on IPFS, Ethereum, and AragonOS, is being revived to make it production-ready. Pando allows communities and decentralized organizations to own their code and repositories in a decentralized manner.

   Vision: The long-term goal is for projects to host their repositories through Pando, with updates requiring community approval via voting. This aligns with Aragon's vision of being fully owned by the community. Multiple Aragon contributors have endorsed Pando.

   Duration and Milestones: The project will not have an end; even if work stops, the code will be maintained by the community. Key milestones include refactoring the code to work with current AragonOS (Aragon Connect in particular) by October 2020, making it as easy to create a Pando organization as a Dandelion one through Aragon (testnet) by January 2020, and launching on Mainnet by March 2020.

   Funding: A request of 3k ANT (approximately 20k USD) is sought to pay the team an equal minimal salary during the 6 months required to achieve these milestones. The funds will be converted into dollars and paid out monthly, with a portion left in ANT for distribution during the final months.

The text discusses a proposed token exchange between AAVE and CRV, two major DeFi protocols, to increase synergies and collaborations between them. The proposal suggests exchanging 2M CRV for approximately 10,710 $AAVE from Aave's ecosystem reserve.

The benefits of this exchange include:
- Being a part of each other's governance processes
- Developing synergistic features such as new Aave pools on Curve and using Curve pools as collateral on Aave
- Increasing TVL (Total Value Locked) and revenues for both protocols

For AAVE, benefits include:
- Participating in Curve governance
- Increasing Aave DAO revenues by using Curve to deposit the treasury on boosted pools
- Earning trading fees in 3CRV tokens by locking CRV
- Diversifying the treasury

For CURVE, benefits include:
- Participating in Aave governance
- Support of the "CRV lockening" by AAVE, increasing the percentage of locked supply
- Opportunities to earn more AAVE and other rewards
- Diversifying the treasury

The community is encouraged to share opinions on the governance forum and vote on snapshot. If the proposal is supported, it will be proposed to Curve DAO as well.

1. What is ApeCast? - ApeCast is an audio feed editor that focuses on creating transcriptions and summaries of podcasts, with the aim of providing a great listening experience for users. It also allows hosts to have complete control over their shows and independent RSS feeds.

2. Why was Apple's initial rejection? - The app was rejected because it had incomplete features, specifically no search and summaries.

3. What changes were made after the rejection? - After the rejection, the team focused on finishing the search and summaries feature instead of removing mentions of summaries or modifying the design of the app.

4. When was ApeCast released? - ApeCast was released on iOS on June 28, 2024. The Android version will be released with the next update.

5. What podcasts are currently available on ApeCast? - Currently, ApeComms, 0xResearch (with transcriptions and summaries), and Mocaverse Hall are available on ApeCast.

6. What improvements have been made since the initial release? - Since the initial release, many bugs have been fixed, the summarization feature has been significantly improved, and the app's update pipeline is being optimized to add episodes more quickly and automate as much as possible.

7. What are the future plans for ApeCast? - The team is working on improving the listening experience by allowing users to search the transcript and play specific areas. They also plan to automate translation in the near future.

This service aims to improve the AI digests based on feedback received, with no risk involved as it is read-only. The team hopes this will help DAOs manage their proposals more efficiently.

The report provided by the Maker DAO risk team for [rETH] Collateral Onboarding Risk Evaluation suggests the following parameters:

- Isolation Mode: No
- Borrowable: Yes
- LTV (Liquidation Threshold): 67%
- LT (Liquidation Tolerance): 74%
- LB (Liquidation Bonus): 7.5%
- RF (Reserve Factor): 15%
- LPF (Liquidation Penalty Factor): 0.1
- Debt Ceiling: Not Applicable (NA)
- Supply Cap: 10K
- Borrow Cap: 1200

The report also recommends starting with conservative parameters for the Interest Rate Curve and Reserve Factor:

- Base: 0
- Slope 1: 0.07
- Uoptimal: 0.45
- Slope 2: 3.0
- Reserve Factor: 0.15

These parameters are designed to minimize risk and allow for optimization later on. The interest rate curve is set up to increase linearly from 0% at 0% utilization to 7% at 45% utilization, then linearly to 307% at 100% utilization, which matches the interest rates of more volatile assets on Aave. This is meant to prevent utilization from reaching 100%, preventing stakers from withdrawing rETH and liquidators from seizing rETH collateral during liquidations.

The proposal aims to deploy the Venus Protocol on Ethereum Mainnet, listing curve tokens crvUSD and CRV as collaterals. It also proposes CRV/XVS rewards for the Venus community and Curve ecosystem. Ethereum hosts significant liquidity and major trades, while Curve is a leading Automated Market Maker (AMM) with $1.8B Total Value Locked (TVL).

The deployment will create visibility for Venus on mainnet, increase adoption for crvUSD, and enable Curve to open pools with Venus assets like XVS and VAI. The proposal includes supply and borrow caps for core and isolated pools on Venus, liquidity mining incentives for crvUSD suppliers, and the creation of pools on Curve.

Curve pools can be created by anyone, but Curve contributors will help optimize parameters. Gauges, which can emit CRV tokens to staked liquid provider pool tokens, may also be deployed. Liquidity providers can earn rewards if Venus contributors or Venus owns veCRV or any other veCRV liquid token like sdCRV/CVX and vote for the gauge. This voting system allows projects to incentivize liquidity by paying it with CRV tokens.

The proposal aims to reach an Annual Percentage Rate (APR) of around 10% within 120 days, but may adjust to market conditions. Curve will also be deployed on Binance Smart Chain (BSC), with Venus assistance.

A proposal for bringing wstETH to the Binance Smart Chain (BNB) is underway, with contributions from ProRel and NEW. The text proposes a community-wide initiative to introduce a small transaction fee on the DEX (Decentralized Exchange) using the CAKE token. This fee, which can range from 0.1% to 1%, is suggested as a means to increase the value of the CAKE token and make it more deflationary over time. Blockchain at Berkeley is partnering with Commonwealth to migrate Compound's governance discussions to the Commonwealth platform, aiming to enhance transparency, engagement, and discussion within the community. The proposal outlines the migration of the current Compound governance forum from Discourse to Commonwealth, offering a unified platform for forum discussions, snapshot votes, and on-chain governance.

Commonwealth is a decentralized tool consolidating various community tools into one place, providing a fully crypto-native forum and voting interfaces. It has been adopted by over 900 DAOs, including dYdX, Stargate Token, Osmosis, Element Finance, Axie Infinity, and Redacted Cartel. The transition process involves importing the Compound Discourse Forum to Commonwealth, integrating governance contracts, and enabling users to access their communities via a single interface.

Key benefits of using Commonwealth include improved access to information, voter education, increased participation, prevention of spam and social engineering attacks, high-touch customer service, and the ability to create separate subDAOs for complex organizational structures. The platform is also planning upcoming initiatives such as notifications, moderation functionality, an API, app store, and more.

For users, migrating to Commonwealth is simple: link a wallet via Metamask or Wallet Connect, join the Compound Commonwealth forum, link the same email used for Discourse, and begin discussions. The roadmap outlines continuous development of key features and workflows based on partner feedback to improve DAO engagement, empower DAO growth, and increase DAO success.

Here is a summary of the roles, responsibilities, and related Maker Improvement Proposals (MIPs) for various Facilitators in the MakerDAO ecosystem:

1. Scope Framework:
   - Stability and Liquidity: SES
   - Decentralized Collateral: BA Labs (ETH Address: 0xDfe08A40054685E205Ed527014899d1EDe49B892)
   - Real World Asset Collateral: SES
   - Ecosystem: SES
   - Protocol Engineering: PE
   - Growth: GRO
   - Physical Resilience: SES
   - Interface: DUX
   - Infrastructure: TECH (ETH Address: 0x2dC0420A736D1F40893B9481D8968E4D7424bC0B)
   - Finance: SF (ETH Address: 0xf737C76D2B358619f7ef696cf3F94548fEcec379)
   - Arbitration: GovAlpha (ETH Address: 0x01D26f8c5cC009868A4BF66E268c17B057fF7A73)
   - Governance Security: PE

2. Pregame bootstrapping:
   - Arbitration Facilitators have the power to make direct constitutional interpretations and edits to the Maker Constitution and Scope Frameworks in case of unintended consequences or mistakes. They can also propose changes through a Governance Poll.

3. MIP113c3: Responsible Facilitators:
   - The Responsible Facilitators are responsible for adhering to the contents of their respective Scope Framework elements and have the governance privilege to interpret, trigger, or use any processes described in the Scope Framework. During the Pregame, the Responsible Facilitators are defined as the Core Unit Facilitators of the Core Units listed as Responsible Facilitator Core Units.

4. MIP113c4: Active Responsible Facilitator Core Unit List Modification Subproposal Process:
   - This component allows for the modification of the list of Responsible Facilitators through a subproposal process. The process has specific parameters, including a default feedback period of 1 month, frozen period of 1 week, and monthly governance cycle.

5. MIP113c5: Scope Framework Articles modification Sub Proposal process:
   - During the Pregame, changes to the Scope Framework articles can be made through a Monthly Governance Cycle using a MIP102c2 subproposal.

Chaos Labs is monitoring the performance of ether.fi's eETH and weETH during market volatility. Despite unprecedented price movements, ether.fi has maintained its functionality safely. Despite recent market sentiment, ether.fi continues to see fresh deposits.

The Aragon Team is preparing for the launch of Aragon Voice, initially intended as a signaling tool for ANT and other ERC20 tokens. Over time, it's expected to be used for binding executions as well. Due to these new functionalities, the Aragon governance process (AGPs) needs updating. The updated AGP process will incorporate Aragon Voice, Aragon Court, and optimistic governance. For now, votes on Aragon Voice concerning the Aragon project, association, or ANT will be signaling votes only, not legally binding actions. A draft proposal for a new AGP process is in development, combining Aragon Voice, Aragon Court, and optimistic governance. In the meantime, the team encourages active voting on Aragon Voice, especially for proposals of interest.

Chaos Labs has proposed initial launch parameters for a Venus isolated pool on Arbitrum, specifically for assets WETH, wstETH, and weETH. The recommendations aim to ensure a safe and efficient launch.

- Collateral Factor: WETH set to 0%, others at 93%. This prevents farming of incentives for WETH while allowing usage in LST/LRT leveraged yield strategies.
- Supply and Borrow Caps: Derived from on-chain liquidity, with borrow caps calculated using the Kink as the optimal point for borrow amounts. wstETH has a lower borrow cap due to limited historical demand.
- IR Curves: WETH's set for profitable leveraged yield strategies at the Kink, while wstETH and weETH's are set higher to prevent manipulation.
- Pricing: Calculated oracle based on exchange rates for wstETH and weETH due to their strong peg stability and anticipated use case.
- Additional Parameters: Close Factor 50%, Liquidation Incentive 2%, minLiquidatableCollateral $100 USD.
- Asset-specific Recommendations: WETH - Liquidation Threshold 0%, Supply Cap 14,000, Borrow Cap 12,500; wstETH and weETH - Liquidation Threshold 95%, Supply Cap 8,000 and 4,600 respectively, Borrow Cap 800 and 2,300 respectively.
- Multiplier and Jump Multiplier values are also provided for each asset.
- Reserve Factor remains the same for all assets at 20% and 25%.

This proposal outlines smart contract upgrades aimed at rescuing user funds, enhancing pausing functionality, and implementing blacklisting for additional safety. The upgrades include a rescue function to transfer tokens from attacker wallets, a global pause feature, and a global blacklist. The blacklisted attacker wallets are listed. The execution of the proposed rescue function and unpausing will be addressed in a future BIP. This expedited BIP is initiated due to timelock considerations, aiming to minimize delays in reopening smart contracts. A supermajority vote of over 70% at a quorum of more than 200,000 votes is required for this proposal to pass. Additionally, older contracts with Timelock as their governance address will be realigned with the rest of the infrastructure. The timelock process will still be necessary for upgrades or adding new strategies.

The text discusses a governance election for the cryptocurrency Sushi. Pancake Swap (PCS) has announced reduced rewards for more farms due to reducing CAKE emissions, aiming to address emission concerns. However, this move has led to less liquidity and eventual fizzling out of DeFi projects on PCS, negatively impacting both PCS and DeFi. The issue lies in the lack of education about earning from pools without Cake rewards, and deincentivizing established PCS ecosystem projects is not a solution. To maintain current CAKE emissions while encouraging more liquidity and pools, it's proposed to create a new farming token designed for future growth. Key features include:
1. Minimum CAKE holdings required
2. Supporting 10X liquidity growth with competitive rewards
3. Higher APR in all pools, including long-term ones
PCS has expertise in creating tokenomics with burn mechanisms to prevent new token dilution.
Choose either option 1 or 2.
Projected increase in cost of a cake by next year is not specified in the provided text.

Title: Tool House Rock #1 - Collaboration Solution for DAOs with Omnistrat

   Event: Join us on February 7th for the first session of Tool House Rock. The guest will be Matt Johnson, Founder of Omnistrat, who will discuss their collaboration solution designed for managing a Decentralized Autonomous Organization's (DAO) strategic plan.

   What is Tool House Rock? A community call to showcase tools and solutions within the MakerDAO Ecosystem, following a consistent presentation agenda.

   What is Omnistrat? Collaboration software for cross-functional teams, featuring strategic planning, member onboarding, organized chat, project management, task management, and a best practice playbook marketplace.

   Join the call via Zoom at the provided link. If you can't attend, post your questions here, and they will be asked during the Q&A. The session will include an introduction of the problem space, product solution demonstration, relevancy with Endgame, and a Q&A.

   Time: February 7th at 4 PM (UTC)
   Location: Zoom Meeting Link provided.

Here is a summary of the proposed Uniswap Gas Rebates Program:

1. A new Safe with an OptimisticGovernor module will be created, and ownership will be transferred to a Uniswap designated multi-sig for safekeeping. The multi-sig will receive $50,000 worth of ETH from the Uniswap Treasury, which will only be used for reimbursing delegates.

2. Gas rebate transactions will be proposed quarterly by the UMA bot (or anyone else) to the optimistic oracle contract. Proposers must post a bond of 2 WETH for a 1-day challenge period.

3. Oracle participants review the proposed transactions using the public script, and if not disputed, gas rebate transactions can be executed via UMA Bot (or anyone else) who covers the gas costs. If disputed, the proposal is escalated to UMA's DVM for dispute resolution between the proposer and disputer.

4. The Uniswap DAO will top up the Safe balance as needed. UMA will develop a gas rebate script and a dune table for easy verification of gas rebate transactions.

5. Anyone can initiate a dispute by navigating to https://oracle.uma.xyz/ and finding the Uniswap gas rebate proposal. UMA token holders vote to resolve disputes, with the correct party rewarded from the opposing partyâ€™s bond.

6. A quarterly report will be provided on the Uniswap forum for transparency regarding the amount of funds disbursed, the number of eligible addresses, etc.

7. The OptimisticGovernor contract has been audited by Open Zeppelin and has over $1B of TVS through UMAâ€™s OO. The module will only be connected to the newly made gas rebate Safe.

8. The proposed optimistic workflow is better suited for ongoing gas rebates than the current Uniswap governance process, as it allows for ongoing rebates without a governance vote each time, verifies transaction data more effectively, and can go from proposal to execution in 24 hours compared to the typical 23 days for a governance proposal under the current process.

9. The next steps include incorporating community feedback, presenting a forum poll to identify eligibility requirements & relevant multisig signers, and moving to a snapshot vote.

The Compound Kit is a developer tool aimed at simplifying application building on the Compound protocol. It eliminates the need for developers to create their own smart contracts by leveraging Protocolink, a versatile router system that bundles multiple functions. The Compound Kit API/SDK generates transaction data based on specified use cases like collateral swap, self-liquidation, leverage, and zap. It also supports fees sharing with developers who initiate transactions to encourage their participation in the ecosystem. The Compound community is invited to provide feedback on the Compound Kit architecture as it moves towards completion of Milestone 1, with the ultimate goal of expanding the Compound ecosystem.

The text describes a plan to establish a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) focused on developing and producing a physical, complex technical product. The goal is to create an organization that can grow with minimal initial investment, allowing members who contribute work to receive shares. The DAO will need to secure patents for core features while keeping other parts open-source. The author seeks guidance on the appropriate template for founding such a DAO, advantages and disadvantages of Ethereum-based versus xDai/IDchain-based types, managing intellectual property discussions, organizing legal protection for inventors, and governing the relationship between inventors and the DAO. The author also questions whether share value will increase with the organization's success and if members receive shares like a unique cryptocurrency for the DAO. Lastly, the author is open to suggestions on the best option for using a crypto wallet and coins for this purpose. The author aims to leverage a DAO to facilitate innovation among inventors.

Title: Proposal for a new Safety Module Category (SM) for GHO/USDC E-CLP built on Balancer v2.

Author: @karpatkey_TokenLogic

Summary: The proposal aims to improve the value proposition of the SM by enabling staking of GHO liquidity pool tokens, providing deep GHO liquidity and protection during protocol shortfall events. It suggests adding a new GHO-USDC E-CLP category to Aave's SM with specific parameters for optimized emissions and FastPass inclusion. The proposal also recommends implementing a strategy that allows the Aave DAO to use its strategic assets to sustain the SM category.

Keywords: Safety Module, GHO/USDC E-CLP, Balancer v2, Liquidity Providers (LPs), Gyroscope Protocol, Elliptic Liquidity Pools (E-CLPs), Aave Liquidity Committee (ALC), APR, FastPass, BAL, AURA, Snapshot stage, AIP stage.

The text proposes an improvement to the safety check for the accounting report in Lido, reducing potential impact size during a negative rebase. The change involves adjusting the sanity check from a daily 5% reduction limit to a 3.4% reduction over an 18-day window (~1.101 ETH per active validator). This is aimed at addressing two out of four cases of 'Natural CLBalance decrease' while relying on a DAO vote for extreme cases until a trustless second opinion source is established. The proposed solution includes the development and audit of a contract, followed by a snapshot vote to gauge sentiment, deployment on testnet, and eventually mainnet voting. Possible secondary opinion sources include ZKP-based Oracles or third-party Oracle committees.

Unified Auctions UI v1.2.1 was released on May 13th, 2022, named Bukowskis. This version focused on the deprecation of the old liquidation portal and introduction of a new notification service. The old liquidation portal is now inaccessible under its original domain but will remain available through a legacy domain for transition purposes.

The Unified Auctions UI handled a high load during the recent market crash, with 257 auctions of 16 different types, including 5 auctions exceeding 1 million Dai. The new version also introduced a notification service to monitor system state changes and respond quickly to events affecting the UI. This service is designed to be modular and reusable for others. Feedback on the updated UI is encouraged, especially from those who used it during the market crash.

Title: Gas Rebate for Recognized Delegates

Author: @lbsblockchain, @MarcZeller Aave-Chan Initiative (ACI)

The ARFC proposes a gas fee reimbursement system for recognized delegates who vote on Aave. This is to address the rising Ethereum gas fees and their impact on on-chain governance costs. The benefits include encouraging active engagement, fostering a diverse voter base, retaining top delegates, and achieving this at a low cost.

Every quarter, an ARFC will be proposed to reimburse gas fees spent by recognized delegates using wETH (Gas Rebate Token). An open-source script will determine the gas fees, and a Governance Facilitator will distribute the reimbursed amount to delegate addresses. The GasRebate Script was developed by a new ACI contributor, @JosepBove.

The text provides an update on recent activities in the APAC region, focusing on DAI, a stablecoin. DAI has been whitelisted in Japan and is listed on GMO coin and Coinbest. To expand its reach, efforts are being made to list DAI on another major Japanese exchange and get it green-listed. DAI is also supported on vivid.money, a challenger bank with about 500k users, offering new use cases such as earning cashback for spending DAI.

Regulatory landscape in Asia is tightening due to the Terra UST collapse, but central banks are exploring wholesale use cases, like Singapore's Project Guardian, which aims to explore DeFi applications in wholesale funding markets.

Strategic focus includes working with institutional borrowers (family offices) for setting up institutional vaults, targeting the growing interest in crypto among Asian families. Efforts are also being made to increase DAI volume and liquidity on exchanges like Binance and Crypto.com, and to bridge DAI to Polygon's zkEVM chain for potential deployment of Maker Protocol.

General integrations include Instadapp, Meshswap, XT com, Bybit (DAI withdrawal to zksync), and Rain (middle east crypto exchange).
